files.name: Cin7 Core Inventory Import
files.content:
# SOP: Importing Inventory CSV into Cin7 Core

**Last Updated:** February 9, 2026
**Cin7 Version:** Cin7 Core (formerly DEAR Inventory)

---

## Prerequisites

- [ ] Cin7 Core account active
- [ ] CSV file with inventory data ready
- [ ] Warehouse/location created in Cin7 Core
- [ ] Price list(s) set up (e.g., KYD Retail, KYD Wholesale)

---

## Step 1: Prepare Your CSV File

Before importing, your CSV needs to match Cin7 Core's expected format.

### Required Columns
| Column | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| ProductCode (SKU) | Your unique identifier | 7C-CAB-SAV-750 |
| ProductName | Full product name | Château Margaux 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml |
| Category | Product category | Red Wine |
| UOM (Unit of Measure) | Selling unit | Bottle |

### Recommended Columns
| Column | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| Barcode | UPC/EAN if available | 1234567890123 |
| Description | Product description | Full-bodied Cabernet from Margaux... |
| Brand | Producer/brand | Château Margaux |
| DefaultPrice | Retail price (KYD) | 85.00 |
| CostPrice | Your cost per unit | 42.00 |
| Weight | Weight in kg | 1.3 |
| Country of Origin | Wine origin | France |
| BinLocation | Where it sits in warehouse | A1-03 |

### Optional Wine-Specific Columns (as custom fields)
| Column | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| Vintage | Year | 2018 |
| Region | Wine region | Bordeaux |
| Varietal | Grape variety | Cabernet Sauvignon |
| Volume | Bottle size | 750ml |
| ABV | Alcohol percentage | 14.5% |

### CSV Formatting Rules
- Save as UTF-8 CSV
- No special characters in SKUs
- Prices as numbers only (no $ or KY$ symbols)
- One row per product
- No blank rows
- Column headers in first row

---

## Step 2: Download Cin7 Core's Import Template

1. Log in to Cin7 Core
2. Go to **Inventory → Products**
3. Click **Import** (top right)
4. Click **Download Template** — this gives you the exact CSV format Cin7 expects
5. Copy your data into this template to ensure column names match perfectly

---

## Step 3: Map Your Data to the Template

1. Open the Cin7 template in Excel/Google Sheets
2. Open your inventory CSV alongside it
3. Copy/paste data from your file into the matching template columns
4. For columns that don't exist in your CSV, leave blank (Cin7 will use defaults)

### Tips:
- If your CSV has different column names, rename them to match the template
- If you have case AND bottle SKUs, import bottles first, then create cases as "Bill of Materials" after
- Double-check prices are in KYD

---

## Step 4: Import into Cin7 Core

1. Go to **Inventory → Products**
2. Click **Import**
3. Select your prepared CSV file
4. Cin7 will show a **preview/mapping screen**:
   - Verify each column is mapped correctly
   - Fix any mismatches (drag/drop or select from dropdown)
   - Check for errors highlighted in red
5. Click **Validate** — Cin7 checks for:
   - Duplicate SKUs
   - Missing required fields
   - Invalid data formats
6. Fix any validation errors
7. Click **Import** to confirm

---

## Step 5: Verify the Import

1. Go to **Inventory → Products**
2. Confirm total product count matches your CSV row count
3. Spot-check 5-10 products:
   - [ ] Product name correct
   - [ ] SKU correct
   - [ ] Price correct (KYD)
   - [ ] Category assigned
   - [ ] Barcode (if applicable)
4. Check for any products that didn't import (Cin7 shows an error log)

---

## Step 6: Set Stock Levels (Stock Adjustment)

The product import creates the products but does NOT set stock quantities. You need a separate step:

1. Go to **Inventory → Stock Adjustment** (or **Stock Take**)
2. Click **New Stock Adjustment**
3. Select your warehouse location
4. You can either:
   - **Manual:** Add products one by one and enter quantities
   - **CSV Import:** Import a stock adjustment CSV with SKU + Quantity columns

### Stock Adjustment CSV Format
| ProductCode | Quantity | Location |
|-------------|----------|----------|
| 7C-CAB-SAV-750 | 48 | Grand Cayman |
| 7C-PIN-NOR-750 | 24 | Grand Cayman |

5. Review the adjustment
6. Click **Authorize** to confirm — stock levels are now set

---

## Step 7: Set Up Case/Composite Products (If Needed)

After bottles are imported, create case SKUs:

1. Go to **Inventory → Products → New Product**
2. Set as **Bill of Materials** (BOM) product type
3. Name: e.g., "Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml — Case of 6"
4. SKU: e.g., 7C-CAB-SAV-750-CS6
5. Add component: 7C-CAB-SAV-750 × 6
6. Set case price
7. Save — Cin7 will auto-calculate case availability from bottle stock

---

## Step 8: Sync to Shopify

Once products and stock levels are set in Cin7 Core:

1. Go to **Integrations → Shopify**
2. Click **Sync Products**
3. Products push to Shopify with prices and inventory levels
4. Verify on 7cellars.ky that products are showing

(See full Shopify integration SOP: `cin7-core-shopify-integration.md`)

---

## Troubleshooting

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Import fails with "duplicate SKU" | Check for duplicate rows in your CSV, or products already in Cin7 |
| Prices not importing | Ensure prices are plain numbers (no currency symbols), check column mapping |
| Categories not matching | Create categories in Cin7 first, then import. Or let Cin7 auto-create them. |
| Special characters in names | Remove or replace accented characters (é → e) if causing issues |
| Stock levels at zero after import | Product import ≠ stock import. Do Step 6 (Stock Adjustment) separately. |
| Too many columns in CSV | Remove extra columns not in the template. Cin7 ignores unmapped columns. |

---

## Checklist Summary

- [ ] Download Cin7 import template
- [ ] Map your CSV data to template format
- [ ] Import products into Cin7 Core
- [ ] Verify product data (spot-check 5-10 items)
- [ ] Import stock levels via Stock Adjustment
- [ ] Create case/composite products (if needed)
- [ ] Sync to Shopify
- [ ] Verify products live on 7cellars.ky

files.name: Cin7 Core Shopify Integration
files.content:
# SOP: Connecting Cin7 Core to Shopify

**Last Updated:** February 9, 2026
**Store:** 7-cellars-2.myshopify.com / 7cellars.ky
**Cin7 Version:** Cin7 Core (formerly DEAR Inventory)

---

## Prerequisites

- [ ] Cin7 Core account active and logged in
- [ ] Shopify store live (7-cellars-2.myshopify.com)
- [ ] Products created in Cin7 Core first (Cin7 = source of truth)
- [ ] Price list set up in Cin7 Core (KYD pricing)
- [ ] Warehouse/location created in Cin7 Core (e.g., "Breezy Castle" or "Grand Cayman")

---

## Step 1: Navigate to Integrations

1. Log in to Cin7 Core (inventory.dearsystems.com)
2. Go to **Integrations → E-Commerce → Shopify**
3. Click **Add New**

## Step 2: Connect Your Shopify Store

1. Enter your store URL: `7-cellars-2.myshopify.com`
2. Click **Connect**
3. Shopify will redirect you to an authorization page
4. Review the permissions Cin7 is requesting
5. Click **Install App** to authorize the connection
6. You'll be redirected back to Cin7 Core

## Step 3: Configure Sync Settings

Once connected, configure these settings:

### Products
| Setting | Recommended Value | Notes |
|---------|------------------|-------|
| Product Sync Direction | **Cin7 Core → Shopify** | Cin7 is the master system |
| Auto-create in Shopify | **Yes** | New Cin7 products auto-push to Shopify |
| Match existing by | **SKU** | Links Cin7 products to existing Shopify products |
| Sync images | **Yes** | Push product images from Cin7 to Shopify |
| Sync descriptions | **Yes** | Push product descriptions to Shopify |

### Pricing
| Setting | Recommended Value | Notes |
|---------|------------------|-------|
| Price List | Select your **KYD retail price list** | This becomes the Shopify price |
| Include tax | **No** | Cayman has no sales tax |

### Inventory
| Setting | Recommended Value | Notes |
|---------|------------------|-------|
| Auto-sync inventory | **Yes** | Real-time stock level updates |
| Warehouse | **Your Cayman warehouse** | Maps to Shopify location |
| Sync on hand qty | **Yes** | Available stock shows on Shopify |

### Orders
| Setting | Recommended Value | Notes |
|---------|------------------|-------|
| Auto-import orders | **Yes** | Shopify orders auto-create Sale Orders in Cin7 |
| Order status | **Authorized** | Orders come in as authorized, ready to process |
| Payment method | Map to your payment gateway | e.g., Cayman Gateway |

## Step 4: Product Field Mapping

Ensure these fields are mapped correctly:

| Cin7 Core Field | Shopify Field |
|----------------|---------------|
| Product Name | Title |
| SKU | SKU |
| Barcode | Barcode |
| Price (from price list) | Price |
| Description | Description |
| Weight | Weight |
| Product Image | Product Image |
| Stock on Hand | Inventory Quantity |

## Step 5: Initial Product Sync

1. Click **Sync Products** to push all Cin7 Core products to Shopify
2. Wait for sync to complete (may take several minutes depending on product count)
3. Go to Shopify Admin → **Products** and verify:
   - All products appear
   - Prices are correct (KYD)
   - Inventory levels match Cin7
   - Images are showing
4. Fix any mapping issues before going live

## Step 6: Test the Order Flow

1. Place a test order on 7cellars.ky
2. Go to Cin7 Core → **Sales → Sale Orders**
3. Confirm the order appeared with correct:
   - Customer info
   - Products and quantities
   - Pricing
4. Process the order in Cin7 Core (Authorize → Pick → Pack → Ship)
5. Verify inventory decremented in both Cin7 and Shopify
6. Verify order status updated in Shopify (fulfilled)

---

## Ongoing Operations

### Daily Workflow
1. **Orders** come in on Shopify → auto-appear in Cin7 Core
2. **Process orders** in Cin7 Core (pick, pack, ship)
3. **Inventory** stays in sync automatically
4. **New products** → add in Cin7 Core first, they push to Shopify

### Adding New Products
1. Create product in Cin7 Core with all details (name, SKU, price, description, barcode)
2. Add product images in Cin7 Core
3. Product auto-syncs to Shopify within minutes
4. Verify on Shopify and assign to collections if needed

### Inventory Adjustments
1. Always adjust inventory in **Cin7 Core** (stock takes, receiving, write-offs)
2. Changes auto-push to Shopify
3. Never adjust inventory directly in Shopify — it will get overwritten

### Price Changes
1. Update price list in **Cin7 Core**
2. Price change auto-syncs to Shopify
3. Never change prices directly in Shopify

---

## Troubleshooting

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Products not syncing | Check integration status in Cin7 → Integrations. Re-sync manually. |
| Inventory mismatch | Run a manual sync. Check if warehouse mapping is correct. |
| Orders not importing | Verify auto-import is enabled. Check Shopify webhook status. |
| Duplicate products | Match by SKU to prevent duplicates. Delete extras in Shopify. |
| Images not showing | Re-sync images. Check image file size (Shopify max 20MB). |

---

## Key Rules

1. **Cin7 Core is the master** — all product data, pricing, and inventory changes happen here
2. **Never edit products directly in Shopify** — changes will be overwritten on next sync
3. **Collections in Shopify** are managed separately (Cin7 doesn't sync collections)
4. **Order processing happens in Cin7 Core** — Shopify is just the storefront
5. **Run a full inventory sync weekly** as a safety check

---

## Support Contacts

- **Cin7 Core Support:** support@cin7.com
- **Cin7 Training:** Your 4-week onboarding program
- **Shopify Support:** help.shopify.com

files.name: Cin7 Quick Reference
files.content:
# Cin7 Core — Quick Reference Guide
## 7 Cellars | Wine & Spirits Distribution
*Last updated: February 2026*

> **Team:** Tallyn (admin, daily ops) · Dwayne (oversight) · Roberto (sales)

---

## ⚠️ Legacy Inventory Tracking (IMPORTANT)

**Custom Field:** `Legacy Inventory` (AdditionalAttribute10) — List: Yes / No

- **All products in Cin7 as of Feb 20, 2026 = Legacy = Yes** (479 products, including California wines)
- **All NEW products added after this date = set to "No"** (Mika handles this during bulk imports)
- **Purpose:** Roberto receives **50% of profit** on Legacy inventory sales. This field allows us to filter sales reports and calculate his payout.

### Running the Roberto Profit Share Report
1. Go to **Reports → Sale Reports** in Cin7
2. Filter by **Additional Attribute 10 = "Yes"**
3. Set date range (monthly)
4. Export — shows all Legacy wine sales with revenue and COGS
5. Calculate: (Revenue - COGS) × 50% = Roberto's share
6. Pay monthly alongside regular commission
> **Onboarding contact:** Nick Dunn (Cin7 Accelerate program)
> **Help docs:** https://help.core.cin7.com

---

## Table of Contents
1. [Getting Started](#1-getting-started)
2. [Products & Inventory](#2-products--inventory)
3. [Purchasing / Supplier Orders](#3-purchasing--supplier-orders)
4. [Sales & Orders](#4-sales--orders)
5. [Shopify Integration](#5-shopify-integration)
6. [Inventory Management](#6-inventory-management)
7. [Reporting](#7-reporting)
8. [Cin7 Pay](#8-cin7-pay)
9. [Common Tasks — Step by Step](#9-common-tasks--step-by-step)
10. [Troubleshooting](#10-troubleshooting)
11. [Keyboard Shortcuts & Tips](#11-keyboard-shortcuts--tips)

---

## 1. Getting Started

### Initial Setup Checklist
- [ ] Subscribe and set up your Cin7 Core account
- [ ] Connect accounting system (Xero or QuickBooks) or use standalone
- [ ] Set up Chart of Accounts and Account Mapping
- [ ] Configure tax rules (Cayman Islands — likely duty-based, no VAT/GST)
- [ ] Set opening balances (conversion date = day you start using Cin7)
- [ ] Add bank accounts
- [ ] Set up locations/warehouses
- [ ] Configure user roles and permissions
- [ ] Import products via CSV
- [ ] Connect Shopify store
- [ ] Set up price tiers (wholesale, retail)
- [ ] Enable batch/lot tracking
- [ ] Enable multi-currency (KYD, USD, EUR)

### Key Settings — Where to Find Them
| Setting | Navigation |
|---------|-----------|
| Company details | **Settings → General** |
| Chart of Accounts | **Settings → Reference Books → Financial → Chart of Accounts** |
| Account Mapping | **Settings → Reference Books → Financial → Account Mapping** |
| Tax Rules | **Settings → Reference Books → Financial → Tax Rules** |
| Opening Balances | **Settings → Reference Books → Financial → Opening Balances** |
| Users & Roles | **Settings → Users and Roles** |
| Locations | **Settings → Reference Books → Locations** |
| Price Tiers | **Settings → General** (tier names) |
| Currency Settings | **Settings → General → Multi-Currency** |
| Integrations | **Settings → Integrations** |

### Required Accounts
These accounts must exist in your Chart of Accounts:

| Account | Type |
|---------|------|
| Inventory Control | Current Asset |
| Inventory Discrepancy | Expense |
| Cost of Goods Sold | Direct Cost |
| Default Revenue | Revenue |
| Tax Liability | Liability |
| Supplier Deposits | Current Asset (accepts payments) |
| Customer Credits | Current Liability (accepts payments) |
| In Transit | Current Asset |
| Work in Progress | Current Asset |

**Recommended optional accounts for 7 Cellars:**
- Inventory Accrual (Goods Received, Not Invoiced) — for shipments from Europe
- Stock in Transit (Goods Invoiced, Not Received) — for containers in transit
- Realized Currency Gains — needed for EUR/USD/KYD conversion

### User Roles & Permissions
Set up at **Settings → Users and Roles**

**Suggested roles for 7 Cellars:**

| User | Role | Key Permissions |
|------|------|----------------|
| Tallyn | Admin | Full access to all modules |
| Dwayne | Manager/Owner | Full access, billing, reports |
| Roberto | Sales Rep | Sales module (full), Inventory (read-only), Products (read-only) |

Key permission areas:
- **Sales** — Orders, quotes, invoices, credit notes
- **Purchases** — POs, receiving, supplier management
- **Inventory** — Stock transfers, adjustments, stocktake, products
- **Reports** — Sales, inventory, purchase reports
- **Ecommerce** — Shopify integration settings

---

## 2. Products & Inventory

### Adding a Simple Product
1. Go to **Inventory → Products**
2. Click **+ New Product**
3. Fill in:
   - **Product Name:** e.g., "Château Margaux 2018"
   - **SKU:** e.g., `CM-2018-750` (your internal code)
   - **Category/Group:** e.g., "Red Wine — Bordeaux"
   - **Brand:** e.g., "Château Margaux"
   - **Default Location:** Main Warehouse
   - **Weight/Dimensions:** for shipping calculations
   - **Barcode (UPC/EAN):** scan from bottle if available
4. Set pricing on the **Prices** tab (see Price Tiers below)
5. Add supplier info on the **Suppliers** tab
6. Save

### Adding Product Families (Variants)
Use Product Families when the same wine comes in different sizes:
1. Go to **Inventory → Products → + New Product Family**
2. Set family name: e.g., "Château Margaux 2018"
3. Add variants:
   - 750ml bottle (SKU: `CM-2018-750`)
   - 1.5L magnum (SKU: `CM-2018-1500`)
   - Case of 6 (SKU: `CM-2018-CS6`)
4. Each variant gets its own SKU, price, and inventory tracking

### Product Categories & Groups
Organize your inventory logically. Suggested structure for 7 Cellars:

```
Wine
├── Red Wine
│   ├── Bordeaux
│   ├── Burgundy
│   ├── Italian Reds
│   └── Other Red
├── White Wine
│   ├── French White
│   ├── Italian White
│   └── Other White
├── Rosé
├── Sparkling / Champagne
└── Dessert Wine
Spirits
├── Whisky
├── Vodka
├── Rum
├── Gin
└── Other Spirits
Beer & Other
Accessories (corkscrews, glasses, etc.)
```

### Units of Measure
Set up units that match how you buy vs. sell:

| Unit | Use Case |
|------|----------|
| Bottle (750ml) | Individual retail sales |
| Case (6-pack) | Wholesale to restaurants |
| Case (12-pack) | Purchasing from suppliers |
| Pallet | Receiving large shipments |

**Tip:** Set the base unit as "Bottle" and configure case quantities as multiples. Cin7 Core handles unit conversion automatically if configured properly. Discuss exact setup with Nick Dunn during onboarding.

### SKU Naming Convention
Suggested format for 7 Cellars:

```
[Producer Code]-[Vintage]-[Size]-[Format]
Example: MARG-2018-750-BTL  (Château Margaux 2018, 750ml bottle)
Example: MARG-2018-750-CS6  (Same wine, case of 6)
Example: SASS-NV-750-BTL    (Sassicaia, non-vintage, bottle)
```

### Inventory Locations
Set up at **Settings → Reference Books → Locations**

Suggested locations for 7 Cellars:
- **Main Warehouse** — primary storage
- **Roberto's Van** — mobile stock for deliveries/tastings
- **Shopify / Online** — mapped to Shopify stock
- **In Transit** — goods on the water from Europe

### Stock Status Definitions
| Status | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| **On Hand** | Physically in that location |
| **Available** | On Hand minus Committed (what you can actually sell) |
| **Committed** | Allocated to confirmed sales orders |
| **On Order** | Ordered from supplier, not yet received |
| **In Transit** | Being transferred between locations |

### Viewing Product Availability
Go to **Inventory → Availability** to see stock across all locations at a glance. You can add a **Stock Value** column if you have permission.

---

## 3. Purchasing / Supplier Orders

### Creating a Purchase Order
1. Go to **Purchases → Purchases**
2. Click **+ → Purchase Order**
3. Select **Supplier** (e.g., your Italian or French wine supplier)
4. Set **Currency** (EUR for European suppliers)
5. Add products and quantities
6. Set expected delivery date
7. **Authorize** the PO to confirm it
8. Email or export PO to send to supplier

### Managing Suppliers
Go to **Purchases → Suppliers** to add/edit:
- Company name, contact details
- Default currency (EUR, USD)
- Payment terms (Net 30, Net 60, etc.)
- Tax rules applicable
- Supplier-specific product pricing

**Tip:** Link products to suppliers on the product's **Suppliers** tab. This pre-fills supplier info when creating POs.

### Receiving Stock
When a shipment arrives:
1. Open the Purchase Order (**Purchases → Purchases → find the PO**)
2. Go to the **Stock Receipt** tab
3. Select the **receiving location** (e.g., Main Warehouse)
4. Enter quantities received (can be partial — e.g., 10 of 12 cases arrived)
5. If using batch/lot tracking, enter **batch/lot numbers** (vintage info)
6. **Authorize** the stock receipt
7. Stock is now live in your inventory
8. Click **Mark as Received** when all goods are in

### Landed Cost Tracking
The landed cost = product cost + freight + customs duties + insurance + currency conversion.

**Method 1: Direct on Purchase**
- Add additional cost lines directly on the purchase invoice
- Costs are distributed proportionally across products based on line cost

**Method 2: Landed Cost Expense Distribution**
1. Receive the freight/customs invoice separately
2. Go to **Purchases → + → Simple Purchase**
3. Enter the expense (e.g., $2,000 freight from Italy)
4. Link it to the original purchase order
5. Cin7 distributes the cost proportionally across products

**Distribution methods:**
- **By Cost** — proportional to each line item's cost (most common)
- **By Weight** — proportional to weight
- **By Quantity** — equal per unit

**This is critical for 7 Cellars** — your true cost per bottle includes shipping from France/Italy, customs duty in Cayman, and insurance. Track this to know your real margins.

### Multi-Currency
Enable at **Settings → General → Multi-Currency**

Relevant currencies for 7 Cellars:
- **KYD** — base/home currency (Cayman Islands Dollar)
- **USD** — common trading currency (KYD is pegged to USD at 1 KYD = 1.20 USD)
- **EUR** — European wine suppliers

Set exchange rates manually or use auto-update. Realized currency gains/losses are tracked in the Realized Currency Gains account.

---

## 4. Sales & Orders

### Creating a Sales Order
1. Go to **Sales → Sales**
2. Click **+ → Sale Order**
3. Select or create a **Customer**
4. Add products and quantities
5. Apply correct **Price Tier** (wholesale or retail)
6. Set payment terms
7. **Authorize** to confirm
8. Process through stages: **Invoice → Pick → Pack → Ship**

### Sales Order Workflow
```
Quote (optional) → Sale Order → Invoice → Pick → Pack → Ship → Payment
```

Each stage can be authorized independently. For 7 Cellars:
- **Wholesale orders:** Full workflow (quote → order → invoice → pick → pack → ship)
- **Roberto's van sales:** Quick sale (skip quote, maybe skip pick/pack)
- **Shopify orders:** Auto-processed (see Shopify section)

### Customer Management
Go to **Sales → Customers**

Set up customers with:
- Contact details (name, address, phone, email)
- **Price Tier** (Wholesale, Retail, VIP, etc.)
- Payment terms (COD, Net 15, Net 30)
- Credit limit
- Tax rules
- Default shipping address
- Notes (e.g., "Prefers Italian reds", "Delivery to loading dock only")

### Price Tiers
Cin7 Core supports up to **10 price tiers**. Configure tier names at **Settings → General**.

Suggested tiers for 7 Cellars:

| Tier | Use Case | Example |
|------|----------|---------|
| Tier 1: Retail | Direct consumers, Shopify | $45.00/bottle |
| Tier 2: Wholesale | Restaurants, bars, hotels | $36.00/bottle |
| Tier 3: VIP/Key Account | High-volume accounts (Ritz, etc.) | $33.00/bottle |
| Tier 4: Staff | Internal/staff pricing | Cost + 10% |

Set prices per tier on each product's **Prices** tab (**Inventory → Products → [product] → Prices Info**).

**Tip:** Assign each customer a default price tier. When you create a sale order for that customer, the correct pricing is auto-applied.

### Quotes
1. Go to **Sales → Quotes**
2. Create quote with products and pricing
3. Email to customer directly from Cin7
4. If accepted, convert to Sale Order with one click

### Invoices
- Auto-generated when the Invoice stage is authorized on a sale
- Can be emailed directly to customers from Cin7
- PDF format, customizable template
- Tracks payment status (unpaid, partial, paid)

### Credit Notes / Returns
1. Open the original sale order
2. Click **Credit Note** or **Return**
3. Select products being returned and quantities
4. Choose: restock items or write off
5. Credit note is applied to customer account
6. If connected to Shopify, refunds sync back

---

## 5. Shopify Integration

### How It Works
Cin7 Core connects to your Shopify store (7cellars.ky) via API. The integration handles:
- **Products:** Cin7 → Shopify (Cin7 is the master for product data)
- **Orders:** Shopify → Cin7 (orders flow into Cin7 for fulfillment)
- **Stock Levels:** Cin7 → Shopify (always pushed from Cin7, never pulled from Shopify)
- **Customers:** Created automatically when orders come in

### Initial Setup
1. Go to **Settings → Integrations → Shopify**
2. Click **Connect** and authorize with your Shopify store credentials
3. Map:
   - **Tax rules** — Shopify tax settings to Cin7 tax rules
   - **Locations** — Shopify locations to Cin7 warehouses
   - **Payment accounts** — Shopify Payments to Cin7 bank account
4. Configure Shopify settings (see below)

### Key Settings (Settings → Integrations → Shopify → Settings)

| Setting | Recommended for 7 Cellars |
|---------|--------------------------|
| Download orders when | **Paid** (download after payment confirmed) |
| Consolidate orders | **No** (individual orders for tracking) |
| Auto-authorize Invoice | **Yes** |
| Auto-authorize Pick | **Yes** |
| Auto-authorize Pack | **Yes** |
| Auto-authorize Ship | **Yes** (or No if you want to manually confirm shipping) |
| Update stock levels | **Automatic** |
| Data master | **Cin7 Core** (Cin7 is the source of truth for products) |

### Product Sync (Cin7 → Shopify)
1. Create/update product in **Inventory → Products**
2. Go to **Settings → Integrations → Shopify → Catalog**
3. Select products to list
4. Click **List** to push to Shopify
5. Products appear on your Shopify store with pricing, images, descriptions

**To update existing products:** Select products → click **Update** to push changes.

### Order Sync (Shopify → Cin7)
1. Customer places order on 7cellars.ky
2. Order automatically downloads to **Sales → Sales** in Cin7
3. Based on your settings, stages may auto-authorize
4. Process fulfillment in Cin7 (pick, pack, ship)
5. Fulfillment status syncs back to Shopify
6. Customer gets shipping notification from Shopify

### Inventory Sync
- **Direction:** Always Cin7 → Shopify
- **Trigger:** Any stock change in Cin7 (sale, receipt, adjustment, transfer) pushes updated quantity to Shopify
- **Enable:** Turn on "Auto-Sync Stock" in Shopify settings
- **Buffer inventory:** Optionally hold back some stock (e.g., show 10 available online but actually have 15 — keeps 5 reserved for wholesale)

### Common Shopify Issues & Fixes

| Issue | Fix |
|-------|-----|
| Product not appearing on Shopify | Check it's listed in the Catalog; verify it's active and not draft |
| Stock showing 0 on Shopify but available in Cin7 | Manually trigger "Update Stock Levels" in Shopify settings |
| Order not downloading to Cin7 | Check order meets download criteria (paid status); check Shopify logs |
| Duplicate products | Check SKU matching; set data master to Cin7 Core |
| Prices wrong on Shopify | Verify the correct price tier is mapped to Shopify |
| Edits in Shopify not reflecting in Cin7 | Shopify edits after download don't sync back — edit in Cin7 |

---

## 6. Inventory Management

### Stock Adjustments
For correcting quantities (damaged goods, miscounts, samples given away):
1. Go to **Inventory → Stocktake and Adjustments**
2. Click **+ → Stock Adjustment**
3. Select location
4. Add products and enter adjustment (+ to add, − to remove)
5. Select reason code (e.g., "Damaged", "Sample", "Shrinkage")
6. **Authorize** to apply

### Stock Transfers Between Locations
Moving wine from warehouse to Roberto's van, for example:
1. Go to **Inventory → Transfers**
2. Click **+ → Stock Transfer**
3. Set **From:** Main Warehouse → **To:** Roberto's Van
4. Add products and quantities
5. **Authorize** to confirm
6. When goods arrive at destination, authorize the **Receipt** stage

### Stocktake / Inventory Count
1. Go to **Inventory → Stocktake and Adjustments**
2. Click **+ → Stocktake**
3. Select **Location** (e.g., Main Warehouse)
4. Cin7 loads all products at that location with expected quantities
5. Count physical stock and enter actual quantities
6. Review discrepancies (Cin7 highlights differences)
7. **Authorize** to apply adjustments automatically
8. Use the Cin7 Core **mobile app / WMS** for barcode scanning during counts

**Tip:** Schedule monthly stocktakes. Do wine and spirits separately if the warehouse is large.

### Low Stock Alerts / Reorder Points
Set reorder points on each product:
1. Go to **Inventory → Products → [product]**
2. Set **Reorder Level** (e.g., 12 bottles = 2 cases)
3. Set **Reorder Quantity** (e.g., 60 bottles = 10 cases)
4. Cin7 flags products below reorder level
5. Use **Purchases → Reorder** to auto-generate POs for low stock items

### Batch / Lot Tracking (Wine Vintages)
**Critical for wine distribution** — track each vintage/lot from purchase through sale.

**Enable:** Settings → General → enable Batch/Lot tracking

When receiving stock:
1. On the Stock Receipt tab of a PO, enter the **Batch/Lot number**
2. Suggested format: `VINTAGE-PRODUCER-RECEIPT` (e.g., `2018-MARGAUX-20260115`)
3. Or simply use the vintage year as the batch number

When selling:
- Cin7 can auto-assign (FIFO — first in, first out) or you can manually select which batch to pick
- FIFO is recommended for wine — sell oldest vintages first (unless customer requests specific vintage)

**Lot Recall:** If there's ever a quality issue:
- Go to **Reports → Inventory → Lot Recall**
- Search by batch number to see every customer who received that batch
- Prepare recall letters directly from Cin7

---

## 7. Reporting

### Key Reports for 7 Cellars

Navigate to **Reports** in the main menu.

#### Sales Reports
| Report | What It Shows | Use For |
|--------|--------------|---------|
| Sales by Product | Revenue per wine/spirit | Identifying best sellers |
| Sales by Customer | Revenue per customer | Key account management |
| Sales by Rep | Sales attributed to Roberto, etc. | Performance tracking |
| Sales Summary | Total sales over a period | Monthly/weekly overviews |
| Outstanding Invoices | Unpaid customer invoices | Collections/follow-up |
| Customer Aging | How long invoices are overdue | Credit management |

#### Inventory Reports
| Report | What It Shows | Use For |
|--------|--------------|---------|
| Product Availability | Stock on hand, available, committed | Quick stock check |
| Inventory Movement Details | All ins and outs per product | Auditing, tracking |


---
*[Document truncated — showing first 500 lines]*

files.name: Cin7 Wholesale Sales Guide
files.content:
# Cin7 — Recording Wholesale Sales (Step-by-Step)

> **For:** Tallyn (7 Cellars Admin)
> **Last Updated:** 2026-02-14
> **Important:** Every wholesale sale MUST be recorded in Cin7 to keep inventory accurate.

---

## Step 1: Create a New Sale

1. From the left menu, click **Sale** → **Sale List**
2. Click the **+ New Sale** button (top right)
3. A blank sale order form will open

---

## Step 2: Select (or Create) the Customer

1. In the **Customer** field at the top, start typing the customer name (e.g., "Kimpton Seafire", "The Ritz-Carlton")
2. If the customer appears in the dropdown, select them
3. **If the customer doesn't exist yet:**
   - Click the **+ New Customer** link that appears
   - Fill in: **Name**, **Contact**, **Email**, **Phone**
   - Set **Payment Term** (e.g., Net 30) — ask Dwayne if unsure
   - Set **Price Tier** to **Wholesale** if available
   - Click **Save**
4. Once selected, their details will auto-fill on the sale

---

## Step 3: Set the Location

1. In the **Location** field, make sure **"Main Warehouse"** is selected
2. ⚠️ **This is critical** — if the wrong location is selected, inventory won't deduct correctly

---

## Step 4: Add Products / Line Items

1. In the **Product** column of the line items section, start typing the wine name
2. Select the correct product from the dropdown
3. Enter the **Quantity** (number of bottles or cases)
4. Repeat for each product in the order

---

## Step 5: Set Wholesale Pricing

1. Check the **Price** column for each line item
2. If a wholesale price tier is set up, it should auto-fill
3. If not, manually type the correct wholesale price per unit
4. You can also apply a **Discount %** per line if needed
5. Verify the **Total** at the bottom looks correct

---

## Step 6: Authorize the Sale

1. Review everything: customer, location, products, quantities, prices
2. Click the blue **Authorize** button (top right of the sale)
3. The status will change from "Draft" → "Authorized"
4. ✅ Once authorized, the sale is confirmed and ready for fulfillment

> **Note:** You can still edit an authorized sale if needed by clicking "Undo Authorize"

---

## Step 7: Pick, Pack & Ship (Deducts Inventory)

This is what actually removes the stock from your inventory:

### Pick
1. On the authorized sale, click the **Pick** button
2. You'll see the items listed — confirm the quantities
3. Click **Authorize Pick** to confirm the items have been pulled from the warehouse

### Pack
1. Click the **Pack** button
2. Confirm the items are packed and ready
3. Click **Authorize Pack**

### Ship
1. Click the **Ship** button
2. If delivering, you can add a tracking number or delivery note (optional)
3. Click **Authorize Ship**
4. ✅ **Inventory is now deducted** from Main Warehouse

> **Shortcut:** For local wholesale deliveries, you can use **Quick Pick/Pack/Ship** if available — this combines all three steps into one click.

---

## Step 8: Create an Invoice

1. After shipping, click the **Invoice** button on the sale
2. Review the invoice details (amounts, tax if applicable)
3. Click **Authorize Invoice**
4. The invoice is now created and can be sent to the customer
5. To email it: click **Email** and send directly from Cin7, or download as PDF

---

## Step 9: Record Payment Received

1. When the customer pays, go to the sale or invoice
2. Click **Payment** or go to **Sale** → **Sale List** → find the sale → click into it
3. Click **Add Payment**
4. Enter:
   - **Amount** received
   - **Payment Date**
   - **Payment Method** (bank transfer, cheque, cash, etc.)
   - **Reference** (e.g., cheque number or transfer reference)
5. Click **Save**
6. ✅ The sale is now fully completed — Paid status will show

---

## Quick Summary / Checklist

| Step | Action | Status Changes To |
|------|--------|-------------------|
| 1-5 | Create sale, add customer & products | Draft |
| 6 | Authorize | Authorized |
| 7 | Pick → Pack → Ship | Fulfilled |
| 8 | Create invoice | Invoiced |
| 9 | Record payment | Paid |

---

## Tips

- **Always check the Location** is set to "Main Warehouse"
- **Don't skip steps** — if you skip Pick/Pack/Ship, inventory won't update
- **Save often** — Cin7 doesn't always auto-save
- **If you make a mistake**, you can usually "Undo" the last step (Undo Ship, Undo Pack, etc.)
- **Questions?** Message this group and Mika or Dwayne can help!

files.name: Corporate Gifting Program
files.content:
# Corporate Gifting Program

## Elevate Every Occasion

Whether you're closing a deal, celebrating a milestone, or simply saying *thank you* — a curated gift from 7 Cellars makes a lasting impression. We combine premium Italian and French wines with artisanal foods — aged cheeses, fine charcuterie, truffle products, and more — into beautifully presented gift boxes delivered anywhere on Grand Cayman.

**Perfect for:** Client appreciation · Holiday gifts · Real estate closings · Corporate events · Employee recognition · Year-end thank-yous

---

## Signature Gift Collections

### The Italian Aperitivo — CI$85–95
A bright, celebratory opener. Prosecco paired with Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano Reggiano, artisanal grissini, and Castelvetrano olives. Light, elegant, and universally loved.

### Tuscan Evening — CI$120–140
An evening in Tuscany, boxed. A fine Chianti Classico alongside aged Pecorino, finocchiona salami, truffle honey, and estate-pressed olive oil. For clients who appreciate the finer things.

### The Grand Cayman Collection — CI$200–250
Our flagship. A structured Barolo paired with Culatello di Zibello, 36-month Parmigiano Reggiano, black truffle paste, and aged balsamic from Modena. A statement gift for your most important relationships.

### French Connection — CI$130–150
Cross the border to France. Champagne paired with aged Comté, saucisson sec, and fleur de sel de Guérande. Refined, sophisticated, unmistakably premium.

### The Essentials Pantry — CI$95–110
All the artisanal food, no alcohol. Aged cheeses, cured meats, truffle honey, olive oil, and crackers — ideal for offices, dietary preferences, or anyone who simply loves great food.

---

## Bespoke & Custom Options

Every organisation is different. We offer fully customisable gift boxes tailored to your brand:

- **Company branding** — Custom packaging with your logo and colours
- **Personal message cards** — Handwritten or printed, included with each box
- **Custom curation** — Select specific wines, spirits, or food items to match your vision
- **Spirits & specialty additions** — Whisky, gin, rum, or caviar upgrades available

> *"We worked with 7 Cellars for our year-end client gifts — the presentation was impeccable and every recipient called to say thank you."*

---

## Volume Pricing

We offer tiered pricing for bulk orders — the more you send, the more you save.

| Order Size | Discount |
|---|---|
| 10–24 boxes | 10% off |
| 25–49 boxes | 15% off |
| 50+ boxes | 20% off |

All pricing is per box. Volume discounts apply across any mix of collections.

---

## White Glove Delivery

Every gift box is delivered with care:

- **Island-wide delivery** across Grand Cayman
- **Temperature-controlled transport** — wines and perishables arrive in perfect condition
- **Flexible scheduling** — same-week delivery for most orders, rush available
- **Presentation guarantee** — every box arrives gift-ready, no assembly required

---

## How It Works

1. **Choose your collection** — Pick from our signature boxes or go fully bespoke
2. **Customise** — Add branding, message cards, or swap items to your preference
3. **Place your order** — We handle the rest, from sourcing to packaging to delivery
4. **Delight your clients** — Sit back and enjoy the thank-you calls

---

## Get Started

Ready to elevate your corporate gifting? Get in touch and we'll put together a proposal tailored to your needs.

| | |
|---|---|
| **Email** | info@7cellars.ky |
| **Phone** | (345) 526 8466 |
| **Web** | www.7cellars.ky |
| **Visit** | Breezy Castle Complex, Unit G9, 125 Owen Roberts Drive, George Town |

**7 Cellars** — Premium Wine, Spirits & Specialty Foods · Grand Cayman

files.name: Gift Box Fulfillment Sop
files.content:
# Standard Gift Box Menu

7 Cellars offers five curated gift box collections, each designed to deliver a memorable unboxing experience. Every box features branded packaging, tissue paper, satin ribbon, a branded sticker seal, and a handwritten or printed personal message card.

## The Italian Aperitivo — CI$85–95

A vibrant, approachable collection perfect for casual celebrations and thank-you gifts.

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|--------------|
| Wine | Prosecco DOC, 750ml (chilled if same-day delivery) |
| Charcuterie | Prosciutto di Parma, pre-sliced ~100g |
| Cheese | Parmigiano Reggiano wedge, ~150g |
| Accompaniments | Grissini breadsticks, Castelvetrano olives (jar) |

## Tuscan Evening — CI$120–140

A rich, indulgent pairing for dinner hosts, housewarming gifts, and real estate closings.

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|--------------|
| Wine | Chianti Classico DOCG, 750ml |
| Cheese | Pecorino Toscano wedge, ~150g |
| Charcuterie | Finocchiona salami, whole or pre-sliced ~120g |
| Accompaniments | Truffle honey (jar), Extra virgin olive oil (250ml bottle) |

## The Grand Cayman Collection — CI$200–250

The flagship gift box — a premium selection for VIP clients, executive gifts, and milestone celebrations.

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|--------------|
| Wine | Barolo DOCG, 750ml |
| Charcuterie | Culatello, pre-sliced ~100g |
| Cheese | Parmigiano Reggiano 36-month aged, ~200g |
| Accompaniments | Truffle paste (jar), Aged balsamic vinegar (250ml, minimum 12-year) |

## French Connection — CI$130–150

An elegant Franco-Italian crossover for Champagne lovers and refined palates.

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|--------------|
| Wine | Champagne (Brut), 750ml |
| Cheese | Comté aged 12+ months, ~150g |
| Charcuterie | Saucisson sec, whole ~200g |
| Accompaniments | Fleur de sel (tin or jar) |

## The Essentials Pantry — CI$95–110

A wine-free option ideal for non-drinkers, office gifts, and dietary-conscious recipients.

| Component | Specification |
|-----------|--------------|
| Cheese | Parmigiano Reggiano wedge, ~200g |
| Charcuterie | Selection of two: prosciutto, finocchiona, or saucisson sec |
| Accompaniments | Truffle honey, extra virgin olive oil, grissini, olives |

---

# Custom & Bespoke Ordering Process

## When to Offer Bespoke

- Corporate orders of 5+ boxes
- Budgets outside standard price points
- Dietary restrictions or specific product requests
- Branded corporate inserts (client's logo, custom message cards)
- Event-specific theming (wedding favours, conference welcome packs)

## Bespoke Order Workflow

1. **Consultation** — Discuss occasion, budget, quantity, dietary needs, and timeline with client (phone or in-person preferred)
2. **Proposal** — Prepare a written quote within 24 hours including component list, per-unit pricing, and delivery schedule
3. **Approval** — Client confirms via email or signed quote; collect 50% deposit for orders over CI$500
4. **Sourcing** — Confirm all components are in stock or order with minimum 10 business days lead time
5. **Assembly** — Follow standard assembly procedure (Section 5)
6. **Client Preview** — Send photo of one completed box for approval before assembling the full run
7. **Delivery** — Coordinate delivery schedule per client requirements

## Minimum Lead Times

| Order Size | Lead Time |
|-----------|-----------|
| 1–5 boxes | 48 hours |
| 6–20 boxes | 5 business days |
| 21–50 boxes | 10 business days |
| 50+ boxes | 15 business days (sourcing dependent) |

---

# Component Sourcing & Inventory

## Sourcing Principles

- All wine and spirits sourced from 7 Cellars' existing portfolio
- Charcuterie and cheese sourced from approved import suppliers with cold-chain compliance
- Accompaniments (oils, honey, vinegar, grissini, olives) sourced from specialty food importers
- No substitutions without client notification and approval

## Inventory Management

### Par Levels

Maintain minimum stock to assemble **10 boxes of each standard collection** at all times. Reorder trigger: stock falls below 5 units of any component.

| Category | Par Level | Reorder Point | Reorder Quantity |
|----------|-----------|---------------|-----------------|
| Wines (per SKU) | 10 bottles | 5 bottles | 12–24 bottles |
| Cheese (per variety) | 10 units | 5 units | 10–15 units |
| Charcuterie (per variety) | 10 units | 5 units | 10–15 units |
| Accompaniments (per item) | 15 units | 8 units | 20 units |
| Gift bags | 50 | 20 | 50 |
| Tissue paper (sheets) | 100 | 40 | 100 |
| Ribbon (spools) | 10 | 4 | 10 |
| Sticker seals | 200 | 80 | 200 |
| Message cards | 100 | 40 | 100 |

### Expiry & Rotation

- **FIFO (First In, First Out)** — always use oldest stock first
- Check expiry dates on all perishable items before assembly
- Cheese and charcuterie: minimum 14 days remaining shelf life at time of assembly
- Remove any items within 7 days of expiry from gift box inventory; redirect to retail or sampling

### Cold Storage

- All cheese and charcuterie stored at 2–6°C
- Assembled boxes containing perishables stored in designated cold area until dispatch
- Maximum time from cold storage to delivery: 2 hours (use insulated bags if ambient temperature exceeds 28°C)

---

# Assembly Workspace Setup

## Dedicated Assembly Area

Designate a clean, well-lit workspace exclusively for gift box assembly. This area must be:

- **Clean** — Wipe down surfaces before each assembly session
- **Organised** — All packaging materials within arm's reach
- **Temperature-controlled** — Perishable components brought out only during active assembly
- **Photo-ready** — Neutral background available for quality-check photography

## Required Materials (Staging Checklist)

Before beginning any assembly session, confirm all materials are staged:

- [ ] Gift bags (correct size for collection type)
- [ ] Tissue paper (branded or neutral cream/white)
- [ ] Satin ribbon (navy or cream)
- [ ] 7 Cellars branded sticker seals
- [ ] Personal message cards (blank or pre-printed)
- [ ] Pen (black ink, for handwritten messages)
- [ ] Wine bottles (room temperature or chilled per collection)
- [ ] Cheese components (still refrigerated)
- [ ] Charcuterie components (still refrigerated)
- [ ] Accompaniment items
- [ ] Insulated bags (for warm-weather deliveries)
- [ ] Camera or phone (for photo confirmation)

---

# Assembly Steps

Follow this sequence for every gift box assembled. No shortcuts.

## Step 1 — Verify the Order

- Confirm collection type, quantity, and any custom requests
- Confirm delivery date, time window, and recipient address
- Confirm personal message text (exact wording from sender)
- Print or write the message card

## Step 2 — Product Selection & Inspection

Pull all components for the order. Inspect each item:

| Check | Pass Criteria |
|-------|--------------|
| Wine bottle | Label clean, undamaged; no seepage at cork/cap; correct vintage |
| Cheese | Vacuum seal intact; no discolouration or mould (beyond expected); expiry 14+ days |
| Charcuterie | Vacuum seal intact; no bloating; expiry 14+ days |
| Accompaniments | Seal intact; label legible; no dents, leaks, or damage |
| Gift bag | No tears, creases, or stains |
| Tissue paper | Clean, unwrinkled |
| Ribbon | Sufficient length (~60cm per box); no fraying |
| Sticker seal | Clean, adhesive intact |
| Message card | Correct message; no smudges or errors |

**If any item fails inspection, replace it. Do not assemble with compromised components.**

## Step 3 — Arrangement

The goal is a visually stunning unboxing experience. Layer as follows:

1. **Base layer** — Two sheets of tissue paper, fanned across the bottom of the gift bag
2. **Anchor** — Place the wine bottle upright at the back-centre of the bag (tallest item anchors the arrangement)
3. **Middle layer** — Position cheese and charcuterie items on either side of the bottle, labels facing forward
4. **Front layer** — Place smaller accompaniments (honey, olives, oil, grissini) in front, filling gaps naturally
5. **Top layer** — Add a final half-sheet of tissue paper, loosely tucked around the tops of items
6. **Message card** — Tuck into the front of the bag, visible but not obscuring products

> **Design principle:** The recipient should see a curated, abundant arrangement — not items rattling in a bag. Every component should be visible and intentional.

## Step 4 — Wrapping & Sealing

1. Gather the top of the tissue paper into a soft fan shape above the bag opening
2. Tie ribbon around the gathered tissue — a clean bow, not a knot
3. Place the 7 Cellars branded sticker seal where the ribbon crosses the bag
4. Ensure the seal is centred and firmly pressed

## Step 5 — Final Quality Check

Before the box leaves the assembly area, perform a final review:

- [ ] Correct collection/components for this order
- [ ] All items properly arranged and visible
- [ ] Message card present with correct text
- [ ] Ribbon tied neatly; sticker seal placed
- [ ] No fingerprints, smudges, or debris on bag or tissue
- [ ] Perishable items still cold to the touch

**Sign off:** Assembler initials and date on the order sheet.

---

# Quality Control Checklist

Use this checklist for every assembled gift box. Document results on the order sheet or digital order record.

| # | Check | ✓ / ✗ |
|---|-------|--------|
| 1 | Correct collection type selected | |
| 2 | All components present per collection spec | |
| 3 | Wine bottle: correct label, vintage, condition | |
| 4 | Cheese: seal intact, expiry 14+ days, appearance | |
| 5 | Charcuterie: seal intact, expiry 14+ days, appearance | |
| 6 | Accompaniments: seals, labels, condition | |
| 7 | Arrangement: visually balanced, labels facing out | |
| 8 | Message card: correct text, legible, positioned | |
| 9 | Tissue paper: clean, properly layered | |
| 10 | Ribbon: neatly tied, appropriate length | |
| 11 | Sticker seal: centred, secure | |
| 12 | Overall presentation: premium, gift-worthy | |
| 13 | Perishables cold to touch | |
| 14 | Photo taken for sender confirmation | |

**Assembler:** _________________ **Date:** _________________

---

# Photography for Sender Confirmation

Every gift box delivery includes a photo confirmation sent to the sender. This is non-negotiable — it closes the loop and builds trust.

## When to Photograph

1. **After assembly** — One photo of the completed box in the assembly area (clean background)
2. **At delivery** — One photo of the box at the recipient's door/reception/desk (if appropriate and discreet)

## Photo Standards

- **Lighting:** Natural or well-lit; no harsh shadows
- **Background:** Clean, uncluttered (assembly table or neutral surface)
- **Angle:** Slightly above, showing the full arrangement and branding
- **Focus:** Sharp; all labels readable
- **No clutter:** Remove any tools, extra materials, or personal items from frame

## Sending to the Sender

- Send both photos (assembled + delivered) via WhatsApp or email within 30 minutes of delivery
- Include a brief message: *"Your gift has been delivered to [Recipient Name]. Here's how it looked! Thank you for choosing 7 Cellars."*
- If the delivery is a surprise, never send the photo to the recipient — only to the sender

---

# Storage of Pre-Assembled Boxes

For efficiency during peak seasons, pre-assemble boxes in advance. Storage rules:

## Non-Perishable Pre-Assembly

Pre-assemble the **dry components only** (wine, grissini, olive oil, truffle paste, balsamic, honey, fleur de sel) in the gift bag with tissue paper and ribbon. Leave space for perishables.

- Store in a cool, dry area away from direct sunlight
- Maximum pre-assembly window: 30 days
- Label each bag with collection type and assembly date

## Perishable Addition

Add cheese and charcuterie **on the day of delivery only.** This ensures:

- Maximum freshness for the recipient
- Cold-chain integrity
- No risk of premature expiry

## Inventory Tracking

Maintain a simple log of pre-assembled boxes:

| Collection | Qty Pre-Assembled | Assembly Date | Perishables Added | Delivered |
|------------|-------------------|---------------|-------------------|-----------|
| Italian Aperitivo | | | | |
| Tuscan Evening | | | | |
| Grand Cayman Collection | | | | |
| French Connection | | | | |
| Essentials Pantry | | | | |

---

# Seasonal Inventory Planning

Gift box demand spikes predictably. Plan ahead to avoid stockouts and rushed sourcing.

## Peak Seasons (Grand Cayman)

| Season | Timing | Expected Demand | Action Required |
|--------|--------|----------------|-----------------|
| Christmas & New Year | Dec 1 – Jan 5 | 3–5× normal volume | Begin sourcing by Oct 15; pre-assemble dry components by Nov 15 |
| Easter | Mar/Apr (variable) | 1.5–2× normal | Source by Feb 15; pre-assemble 2 weeks prior |
| Pirates Week | Mid-November | 1.5–2× normal | Source by Oct 1; overlap with Christmas prep |
| Valentine's Day | Feb 14 | 1.5× normal | Source by Jan 15; consider limited-edition "couples" box |
| Corporate Year-End | Nov–Dec | Included in Christmas spike | Engage corporate clients by Oct 1 for bulk orders |

## Seasonal Preparation Checklist

**8 weeks before peak:**
- [ ] Review prior year's sales data (or estimate for first year)
- [ ] Contact suppliers for lead times and availability
- [ ] Place orders for all non-perishable components
- [ ] Order additional packaging materials (bags, ribbon, seals, cards)

**4 weeks before peak:**
- [ ] Confirm all non-perishable stock has arrived
- [ ] Begin pre-assembling dry components
- [ ] Confirm perishable supplier delivery schedule for peak period
- [ ] Brief delivery team on increased volume and scheduling

**1 week before peak:**
- [ ] Final inventory count — identify and fill any gaps
- [ ] Confirm all corporate/bulk orders and delivery schedules
- [ ] Pre-print message cards for confirmed orders
- [ ] Stage workspace for high-volume assembly

---

# Corporate Gifting Program

Corporate gifts represent the highest volume and highest lifetime value segment. Treat every corporate client as a relationship, not a transaction.

## Program Structure

### Standard Corporate Offering

- Any collection from the standard menu at listed prices
- 10% discount on orders of 10+ boxes
- 15% discount on orders of 25+ boxes
- Custom message cards included at no extra charge

### Bespoke Corporate Packages

- Fully customised component selection
- Client's branded inserts or co-branded packaging available (minimum 25 units)
- Dedicated account contact for repeat clients
- Quarterly check-ins for recurring gift programs (e.g., client onboarding gifts, quarterly staff rewards)

## Corporate Client Onboarding

1. **Initial meeting** — Understand their gifting needs, budget, frequency, and brand guidelines
2. **Sample box** — Provide one complimentary sample of the proposed collection
3. **Proposal** — Formal quote with pricing tiers, customisation options, and delivery logistics
4. **Agreement** — Simple letter of intent or standing order agreement for recurring clients
5. **First order** — Execute with heightened attention; request feedback after delivery
6. **Follow-up** — 2 weeks post-delivery, check in; schedule next order or quarterly review

## Key Corporate Segments (Grand Cayman)

| Segment | Use Case | Typical Collection | Frequency |
|---------|----------|-------------------|-----------|
| Real Estate Agencies | Closing gifts for buyers | Tuscan Evening, Grand Cayman | Per transaction |
| Law Firms | Client appreciation, deal closings | Grand Cayman, French Connection | Quarterly / ad hoc |
| Financial Services | Client onboarding, year-end gifts | Grand Cayman Collection | Year-end + ad hoc |
| Hotels & Resorts | VIP guest welcome amenities | Italian Aperitivo, Essentials Pantry | Ongoing |
| Event Planners | Conference welcome packs, wedding favours | Custom / Essentials Pantry | Per event |

---

# Delivery Protocol for Gift Boxes

Gift delivery is the final impression — and the most visible. A flawless delivery elevates the entire experience. A sloppy one undermines everything.

## Pre-Delivery Checklist

- [ ] Gift box has passed final quality check (Section 6)
- [ ] Photo of assembled box taken and saved (Section 7)
- [ ] Delivery address confirmed with sender (unit number, gate codes, building name)
- [ ] Delivery time window confirmed
- [ ] Recipient name confirmed (for handoff)
- [ ] Insulated bag ready if perishables included and ambient temperature exceeds 28°C
- [ ] Vehicle clean and presentable

## During Transit

- Gift boxes transported **upright** at all times — never on their side
- Secure boxes so they do not slide or tip during transit (use a crate or box divider)
- If delivering multiple boxes, separate with padding to prevent contact damage
- Keep vehicle air-conditioned for perishable deliveries

## At Delivery

1. **Arrive on time** — Within the confirmed delivery window. If delayed, notify the sender immediately
2. **Present professionally** — Clean appearance, polite greeting
3. **Identify the recipient** — *"Good afternoon, I have a gift delivery for [Name] from [Sender/Company]."*
4. **Hand over carefully** — Place the box in the recipient's hands or on a designated surface; never leave unattended on a doorstep
5. **Do not reveal the sender** unless the message card or sender has instructed otherwise
6. **Photograph** — Discreetly take a delivery photo (box at reception desk, in recipient's hands if they consent, or at the door)
7. **Confirm delivery** — Text or WhatsApp the sender: *"Delivered to [Recipient Name] at [time]. Photo attached."*

## Failed Delivery

If the recipient is unavailable:

1. Call the recipient (if number provided by sender)
2. If no answer, contact the sender for alternative instructions
3. **Do not leave the box unattended** — perishable items will spoil; the presentation will be compromised
4. Return the box to cold storage and reschedule within 24 hours
5. If perishables have been out of cold storage for 2+ hours, replace them before re-delivery

## Delivery Timeframes

| Service Level | Window | Availability |
|--------------|--------|-------------|
| Same-day delivery | Order by 11:00 AM, deliver by 5:00 PM | Monday–Saturday |
| Next-day delivery | Order by 5:00 PM, deliver next business day | Monday–Saturday |
| Scheduled delivery | Client specifies date and time window | Monday–Saturday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM |
| Sunday/Holiday delivery | By prior arrangement only | Subject to availability and surcharge |

---

# Document Control

| Version | Date | Author | Changes |
|---------|------|--------|---------|
| 1.0 | February 2026 | 7 Cellars Operations | Initial release |

*This SOP is a living document. Review quarterly and update as products, packaging, or processes change.*

files.name: Inventory Management Sop
files.content:
# Container Receiving & Intake

## Overview

This SOP covers the end-to-end inventory management process for 7 Cellars, from container arrival at Grand Cayman through ongoing stock management. Given the tropical climate, temperature control and efficient intake are critical to preserving product quality.

**Scope:** Wine, spirits, and specialty food products (cheese, charcuterie, olive oil, truffle products)

**Key Personnel:**

| Role | Person | Responsibility |
|------|--------|----------------|
| Product Selection & Ordering | Roberto | Supplier relationships, container planning, product mix |
| Administration | Tallyn | Cin7 data entry, purchase orders, reporting |
| Ground Operations | Kyle | Unloading, storage, temperature monitoring, deliveries |

---

## Pre-Arrival Preparation

### 1–2 Weeks Before Container Arrival

- **Roberto** confirms final packing list with suppliers (Italy, France)
- **Tallyn** creates Purchase Order in Cin7 with all expected SKUs, quantities, and costs
- **Kyle** prepares warehouse: clears receiving area, verifies cold storage capacity, checks temperature monitoring equipment
- Pre-sold allocations are flagged in Cin7 — target is **50% pre-sold per container** (currently ~6 of 21–22 pallets)
- Remaining speculative inventory is tagged for general stock

### Container Shipping Timeline

- Standard 40-foot containers from Italy/France
- **Plan 6–8 weeks transit time** to Grand Cayman
- Example: Ship by Feb 26 → Arrive mid-April for Easter rush
- Factor in customs clearance: **2–5 business days** after port arrival

---

## Container Arrival & Unloading

### Day of Arrival

**Kyle leads ground operations. Tallyn on standby for Cin7 intake.**

#### Step 1: Inspect the Container

- Photograph container seal number — match against shipping documents
- Check seal integrity before breaking
- Note container condition (dents, water damage, odors)
- **Record internal temperature** immediately upon opening (wine must be below 22°C / 72°F)
- If temperature exceeds 22°C, photograph the thermometer and document in Cin7 notes — flag for quality review

#### Step 2: Unload & Stage

- Unload pallets onto receiving dock
- Separate into two staging zones:
  - **Pre-Sold** — pallets/cases already allocated to restaurant accounts
  - **Speculative** — general inventory for stock
- Count pallets against packing list as they come off
- Flag any visible damage (crushed boxes, broken bottles, wet cartons) — **do not move damaged goods to storage until documented**

#### Step 3: Pallet-Level Verification

For each pallet:

- Match product labels to packing list
- Count cases per pallet
- Check vintage/lot numbers match order
- Note any substitutions or shorts

---

## Cin7 Intake & Scanning

### Receiving into Cin7

**Tallyn performs intake. Kyle provides physical counts.**

#### Step 1: Open the Purchase Order

- Navigate to the existing PO in Cin7
- Begin receiving against the PO line by line

#### Step 2: Scan or Enter Each Product

- Use barcode scanner where labels are available
- For products without barcodes, search by SKU or product name
- Enter **actual quantity received** (may differ from PO quantity)
- Record any discrepancies:
  - Short shipments → note on PO, notify Roberto
  - Overages → receive and note
  - Wrong items → quarantine, do not receive into stock

#### Step 3: Assign Storage Location

- Each product gets a bin/location code in Cin7:
  - **CS-##** — Cold storage rack positions
  - **DS-##** — Dry storage (spirits, shelf-stable foods)
  - **QZ** — Quarantine zone (damaged/suspect items)
- Location must be recorded at intake — no "floating" inventory

#### Step 4: Tag Speculative vs Pre-Sold

- Pre-sold inventory: apply customer allocation tag in Cin7
- Speculative inventory: tag as **Available** for general sale
- This distinction syncs to Shopify — pre-sold items should not show as available online

#### Step 5: Complete the Receipt

- Finalize the PO receipt in Cin7
- Cin7 automatically updates stock levels and syncs to Shopify
- Print receipt summary for warehouse records
- **Tallyn sends intake summary to Roberto** — total received, shorts, damages, pre-sold vs speculative split

---

## Storage & Temperature Management

### Storage Placement Rules

| Product Type | Storage Zone | Temperature | Notes |
|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------|
| Red wine | Cold storage | 14–18°C (57–64°F) | Away from direct light |
| White wine / Rosé | Cold storage | 10–14°C (50–57°F) | Lower shelf preferred |
| Sparkling wine | Cold storage | 7–10°C (45–50°F) | Stored on side or inverted |
| Spirits | Dry storage | Below 25°C (77°F) | Ambient acceptable |
| Cheese / Charcuterie | Refrigerated | 2–6°C (36–43°F) | Check expiry dates |
| Olive oil / Truffle products | Dry storage | Below 22°C (72°F) | Away from heat sources |

### Temperature Monitoring

- **Kyle checks and logs temperatures twice daily** — morning (before 9 AM) and afternoon (after 2 PM)
- Use digital thermometer or connected sensor in each storage zone
- Log readings in the Temperature Log (posted in warehouse and backed up weekly)
- **Alert thresholds:**
  - Wine storage exceeds 22°C → immediate action required
  - Refrigerated goods exceed 8°C → check equipment immediately
- If cooling fails: contact refrigeration service **within 1 hour**, begin relocating sensitive products to backup cold storage or partner facility

### FIFO Rotation (First In, First Out)

- **All products follow FIFO** — oldest stock ships first
- When new inventory arrives, place behind or below existing stock
- Kyle marks arrival date on each case/pallet with marker or label
- During picks, always pull from the front/top (oldest)
- **Monthly FIFO audit** — Kyle walks the warehouse and flags any out-of-order stock

---

## Cycle Counts & Stock Accuracy

### Weekly Spot Counts

- **Kyle performs spot counts on 10–15 SKUs per week** (rotating selection)
- Compare physical count to Cin7 on-hand quantity
- Record discrepancies in the Cycle Count Log
- Acceptable variance: ±1 unit per SKU
- Variances beyond ±1: investigate (theft, breakage, mis-pick, data entry error)

### Monthly Full Count (High-Value Items)

- Full physical count of all wines over $50 retail and all spirits
- **Tallyn reconciles** Cin7 against physical counts
- Adjust Cin7 quantities with adjustment reason codes:
  - **BRK** — Breakage
  - **SHR** — Shrinkage/unknown loss
  - **ADM** — Admin error (data entry)
  - **DMG** — Damaged/write-off
  - **SAM** — Sample/tasting use

### Quarterly Full Inventory

- Complete physical count of all SKUs
- Coordinate: Kyle counts, Tallyn records, Roberto reviews final report
- Cin7 stock adjustment report generated and filed
- Target stock accuracy: **98% or higher**

---

## Par Levels & Restaurant Account Management

### Setting Par Levels

Par levels are maintained for key restaurant and bar accounts to ensure consistent supply.

**Roberto sets par levels based on:**

- Account's average monthly consumption (3-month rolling average)
- Seasonal adjustments (tourist high season: Nov–Apr)
- Menu changes or new wine list additions
- Storage capacity at the account's location

### Par Level Table (Example Format)

| Account | Product | Par Level (cases/month) | Reorder Point | Notes |
|---------|---------|------------------------|---------------|-------|
| Restaurant A | Prosecco XYZ | 4 | 2 | Increases to 6 in Dec–Mar |
| Bar B | House Red Blend | 3 | 1 | Weekly delivery preferred |
| Hotel C | Olive Oil 500ml | 2 | 1 | Seasonal menu item |

### Monitoring Par Levels

- **Tallyn runs a weekly Cin7 report** showing current stock vs par for each restaurant account
- When stock hits the reorder point, Tallyn flags it for Roberto's review
- Roberto confirms reorder or adjusts based on account feedback
- Delivery scheduled with Kyle

---

## Reorder Triggers & Container Planning

### Automatic Reorder Triggers (Cin7)

Configure reorder points in Cin7 for core products:

- **Reorder Point** = Average monthly sales × 2 months (to cover transit time)
- **Safety Stock** = 1 month of average sales
- **Reorder Quantity** = Container-optimized case count (full pallets preferred)

### When to Plan the Next Container

| Trigger | Action |
|---------|--------|
| 3+ core SKUs hit reorder point | Roberto begins container planning |
| Pre-sold commitments reach 50%+ of container capacity | Green light to ship |
| Seasonal deadline approaching (Easter, Christmas, tourist season) | Ship regardless of pre-sold % — stock must arrive in time |
| New product launch scheduled | Include launch quantities in next container |

### Container Planning Process

1. **Roberto** reviews reorder report from Cin7 and restaurant account needs
2. **Roberto** builds container order with suppliers — target 21–22 pallets per 40-foot container
3. **Goal: 50% pre-sold before shipping** — Roberto works accounts to secure commitments
4. **Tallyn** creates PO in Cin7 once order is confirmed
5. **Roberto** confirms ship date with freight forwarder — allow 6–8 weeks for transit

---

## Damaged & Defective Product Handling

### At Receiving

- Damaged items are separated to the **Quarantine Zone (QZ)** during unloading
- Kyle photographs all damage (individual bottles and outer packaging)
- Tallyn records in Cin7 with adjustment code **DMG** and attaches photos to the PO notes

### Post-Receiving (Warehouse Damage)

- Any breakage or damage discovered after intake is reported to Tallyn immediately
- Tallyn adjusts Cin7 inventory with appropriate reason code
- If supplier defect (cork taint, sediment, label error): Roberto contacts supplier for credit

### Disposition

| Condition | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| Broken bottle | Dispose safely, adjust Cin7, log in Damage Report |
| Damaged label (product intact) | Move to "B-stock" — available for by-the-glass or staff purchase at discount |
| Cork taint or spoilage | Quarantine, notify Roberto, supplier claim |
| Damaged outer packaging only | Repackage if product is intact, note in Cin7 |
| Temperature-compromised | Quarantine for Roberto's assessment — may be sellable at discount or written off |

### Monthly Damage Summary

- Tallyn compiles monthly damage/loss report from Cin7 adjustment logs
- Report includes: total units lost, estimated cost, cause breakdown
- Roberto reviews and identifies patterns (recurring supplier issues, handling problems)

---

## Speculative vs Pre-Sold Inventory Tracking

### Definitions

- **Pre-Sold:** Committed to a specific customer/account before or at time of container shipment. Reserved in Cin7 — does not appear as available on Shopify.
- **Speculative:** Ordered based on projected demand without a confirmed buyer. Available for sale via all channels (Shopify, direct sales, restaurant accounts).

### Tracking in Cin7

- Use **Sales Order** status to distinguish:
  - Pre-sold items have a Sales Order created at time of container planning
  - Speculative items have no associated Sales Order until sold
- **Tallyn tags** each received item's allocation status during intake
- Roberto reviews speculative-to-sold conversion weekly

### Performance Target

- **50% pre-sold per container** (by pallet count)
- Track actual vs target per container shipment
- Roberto reports conversion rate to ownership monthly

### Converting Speculative to Sold

- As speculative inventory sells, Tallyn creates Sales Orders in Cin7
- Cin7 updates available stock and syncs to Shopify automatically
- If speculative inventory ages beyond **90 days**, Roberto reviews for:
  - Price adjustment / promotion
  - Reallocation to restaurant accounts
  - Bundling with other products

---

## Daily, Weekly & Monthly Checklists

### Daily (Kyle)

- [ ] Morning temperature check and log (before 9 AM)
- [ ] Afternoon temperature check and log (after 2 PM)
- [ ] Visual walk-through of storage areas
- [ ] Report any breakage or anomalies to Tallyn

### Weekly (Tallyn + Kyle)

- [ ] Spot count 10–15 SKUs (Kyle counts, Tallyn reconciles)
- [ ] Run par level report for restaurant accounts
- [ ] Review and action reorder alerts from Cin7
- [ ] Update speculative inventory status

### Monthly (All)

- [ ] Full count of high-value items (Kyle + Tallyn)
- [ ] Damage/loss summary report (Tallyn)
- [ ] FIFO rotation audit (Kyle)
- [ ] Par level review with restaurant accounts (Roberto)
- [ ] Speculative inventory aging review (Roberto)
- [ ] Temperature log backup and review (Kyle)

### Quarterly (All)

- [ ] Full physical inventory count
- [ ] Stock accuracy report and Cin7 reconciliation
- [ ] Container performance review (pre-sold vs speculative targets)
- [ ] Storage equipment maintenance check
- [ ] SOP review and updates

---

## Appendix: Cin7 Quick Reference

| Task | Cin7 Path |
|------|-----------|
| Create Purchase Order | Buying → Purchase Orders → New |
| Receive Against PO | Buying → Purchase Orders → [Select PO] → Receive |
| Stock Adjustment | Inventory → Stock Adjustments → New |
| Run Stock Report | Reports → Inventory → Stock On Hand |
| Set Reorder Point | Products → [Select Product] → Reorder Settings |
| View Par Levels | Reports → Custom → Par Level Report |
| Cycle Count | Inventory → Stocktake → New |

---

*This SOP is a living document. Review quarterly and update as processes evolve. Last updated: February 2026.*
