files.content:
# Order Processing

## 1. Purpose

This SOP defines the end-to-end process for receiving, processing, fulfilling, and delivering customer orders at 7 Cellars. It ensures every order — whether B2B, B2C, yacht provisioning, or gift — receives the same level of precision, professionalism, and white-glove care that defines our brand.

## 2. Scope

Applies to all order channels: phone, WhatsApp, email, Shopify (e-commerce), and in-person requests. Covers the complete lifecycle from initial customer contact through post-delivery follow-up.

## 3. Roles & Responsibilities

| Role | Person | Responsibilities |
|------|--------|-----------------|
| Director of Sales | Roberto Logioia | B2B client management, wine recommendations, key account orders, tasting notes |
| Admin & Order Coordinator | Tallyn | Order entry into Cin7, scheduling, invoicing, customer communication |
| Operations (On-Ground) | Kyle | Warehouse oversight, delivery logistics, quality control |
| Finance | Darryl | Payment reconciliation, credit terms approval, AR management |
| Strategy & Systems | Dwayne | Cin7/Shopify configuration, process optimization, reporting |

## 4. Order Channels

### 4.1 Phone Orders
- Answered by Tallyn or Roberto during business hours (Mon–Sat, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM)
- Capture: customer name, contact info, items requested, quantities, delivery address, preferred delivery window
- Confirm order details verbally before ending the call

### 4.2 WhatsApp Orders
- Primary channel for B2B accounts and repeat customers
- Respond within **30 minutes** during business hours
- Screenshot or text confirmation sent to customer before processing
- Save conversation thread for order reference

### 4.3 Email Orders
- Orders received at **orders@7cellars.ky**
- Acknowledge receipt within **1 hour** during business hours
- Reply with order summary and estimated delivery window

### 4.4 Shopify (Online Store)
- Orders auto-sync from Shopify to Cin7 via integration
- Shopify sends automated order confirmation to customer
- Tallyn reviews incoming Shopify orders every **30 minutes** during business hours
- Flag any issues (out-of-stock, address problems) immediately

### 4.5 Yacht Provisioning
- Orders typically received via WhatsApp, email, or concierge referral
- Require: vessel name, marina/dock location, arrival date/time, contact person aboard
- Priority handling — confirm availability within **1 hour**
- Coordinate delivery timing with marina access and vessel schedule

### 4.6 Gift Orders
- May include custom notes, gift wrapping, or curated selections
- Capture: recipient name, delivery address, gift message, any presentation instructions
- Roberto may assist with wine selection for curated gift packages

---

## 5. Process Flowchart

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    ORDER RECEIVED                        │
│  Phone │ WhatsApp │ Email │ Shopify │ Yacht │ Gift      │
└────────────────────────┬────────────────────────────────┘
                         │
                         ▼
              ┌─────────────────────┐
              │  CAPTURE ORDER INFO │
              │  Customer, items,   │
              │  qty, address, notes│
              └──────────┬──────────┘
                         │
                         ▼
              ┌─────────────────────┐
              │  ENTER INTO CIN7    │
              │  Create Sales Order │
              │  Verify stock levels│
              └──────────┬──────────┘
                         │
                    ┌────┴────┐
                    ▼         ▼
             ┌──────────┐ ┌──────────────┐
             │ IN STOCK │ │ OUT OF STOCK  │
             └────┬─────┘ └──────┬───────┘
                  │              │
                  │              ▼
                  │    ┌──────────────────┐
                  │    │ Notify customer, │
                  │    │ offer substitute │
                  │    │ or backorder     │
                  │    └──────┬───────────┘
                  │           │
                  ◄───────────┘
                  │
                  ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │ PAYMENT PROCESSING│
        │ B2C: Pay at order │
        │ B2B: Net terms    │
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │   PICK & PACK    │
        │ Pull from stock, │
        │ branded packaging│
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │  QUALITY CHECK   │
        │ Verify items,    │
        │ condition, temp  │
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │ SCHEDULE DELIVERY │
        │ Confirm window   │
        │ with customer    │
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │    DELIVERY      │
        │ Temperature-     │
        │ controlled,      │
        │ white glove      │
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │   CONFIRMATION   │
        │ Photo proof,     │
        │ customer sign-off│
        └────────┬─────────┘
                 │
                 ▼
        ┌──────────────────┐
        │  POST-DELIVERY   │
        │  FOLLOW-UP       │
        │  Thank you +     │
        │  feedback        │
        └──────────────────┘
```

---

## 6. Detailed Process Steps

### Step 1 — Order Entry into Cin7

1. Open Cin7 Core and navigate to **Sales > New Sales Order**
2. Select or create the customer profile
3. Add line items — search by SKU, product name, or scan barcode
4. Verify **Available Stock** column shows sufficient inventory
5. Add any order notes (gift message, delivery instructions, yacht details)
6. Set the **Delivery Date** based on customer request and delivery schedule
7. Assign the appropriate **Sales Channel** tag:
   - `B2B-Restaurant` / `B2B-Hotel` / `B2C-Online` / `B2C-Phone` / `Yacht` / `Gift`
8. Save the Sales Order — status moves to **Draft**

### Step 2 — Payment Processing

**B2C Orders (Retail / Online / Gift)**
- Shopify orders: payment captured at checkout (credit card via Shopify Payments)
- Phone/WhatsApp orders: send payment link or take card details over the phone
- Payment must be confirmed **before** pick & pack begins

**B2B Orders (Restaurants / Hotels)**
- Net 30 payment terms (standard) — requires approval from Darryl
- New B2B accounts: first two orders require payment on delivery (COD)
- Invoice generated in Cin7 upon order confirmation
- Statement sent monthly; follow up on overdue accounts at Net 45

**Yacht Provisioning**
- Payment required in advance (wire transfer or credit card)
- For established yacht management companies: Net 15 terms with Darryl's approval

> **Note:** All credit term decisions are approved by Darryl. Roberto and Tallyn do not extend credit without authorization.

### Step 3 — Pick & Pack

1. Print the **Pick List** from Cin7 for confirmed orders
2. Pull items from warehouse shelves — check each bottle against the pick list
3. Inspect every bottle:
   - Label condition (no tears, staining, or damage)
   - Capsule/cork integrity
   - Fill level appropriate for the wine's age
4. Pack in **7 Cellars branded packaging**:
   - Tissue wrap for premium bottles
   - Branded box or bag (based on order size)
   - Include tasting cards where applicable
   - Add gift note/ribbon for gift orders
5. Place packed order in the **temperature-controlled staging area**
6. Mark order as **Packed** in Cin7

### Step 4 — Quality Check

Before any order leaves the building:

| Check | Standard | Action if Failed |
|-------|----------|-----------------|
| Correct items | Matches sales order exactly | Replace with correct item |
| Correct quantities | Count matches order | Adjust and recount |
| Bottle condition | No damage, proper labels | Swap for replacement bottle |
| Temperature | Stored below 18°C / 65°F | Return to climate control, delay if needed |
| Packaging | Clean, branded, professional | Repack |
| Gift presentation | Note included, wrapping correct | Redo presentation |
| Documentation | Invoice/receipt included | Print and include |

Quality check is performed by the person who **did not** pick the order (four-eyes principle).

### Step 5 — Delivery Scheduling

1. Review confirmed orders for the day by **10:00 AM**
2. Group deliveries by geographic zone:
   - **Zone A:** Seven Mile Beach corridor (hotels, condos, restaurants)
   - **Zone B:** George Town / Camana Bay
   - **Zone C:** East End / North Side / Bodden Town
   - **Zone D:** Marinas & yacht clubs
3. Contact customers to confirm delivery window (morning or afternoon)
4. Sequence route for efficiency — prioritize:
   - Time-sensitive orders (yacht departures, event prep)
   - B2B lunch service needs (deliver by 11:00 AM)
   - Scheduled appointment windows
5. Update Cin7 order status to **Out for Delivery**
6. Load vehicle — verify temperature-controlled compartment is at correct temperature

### Step 6 — Delivery Execution

- Deliver in **branded 7 Cellars vehicle** (temperature-controlled)
- Driver/delivery person presents professionally — clean, branded attire
- Present order to customer, walk through items if appropriate
- For B2B: deliver to designated receiving area, obtain signature
- For B2C: hand-deliver to customer, verify age (21+ for Cayman Islands)
- For Yacht: coordinate with crew, deliver dockside or aboard as arranged
- Capture **photo proof of delivery** (packages at door, signature, or handoff)

### Step 7 — Delivery Confirmation

1. Mark order as **Delivered** in Cin7 immediately upon completion
2. Send delivery confirmation to customer via their preferred channel:
   - WhatsApp message with photo (most common)
   - Email confirmation for corporate/B2B accounts
3. Update the daily delivery log

### Step 8 — Post-Delivery Follow-Up

| Timing | Action | Channel | Owner |
|--------|--------|---------|-------|
| Same day | "Thank you" message with delivery photo | WhatsApp / Email | Tallyn |
| 3 days (B2C first-time) | Personal check-in — "How are you enjoying the wines?" | WhatsApp / Phone | Roberto |
| 7 days (B2B new account) | Quality check — "Is everything meeting expectations?" | Phone / In-person | Roberto |
| 14 days (Yacht) | Follow-up with management company for future provisioning | Email | Roberto |
| Monthly (B2B) | Account review — reorder suggestions, new arrivals | In-person / Email | Roberto |

---

## 7. Special Handling Procedures

### Temperature-Sensitive Orders
- All wine must remain below **18°C / 65°F** throughout the chain
- During summer months (May–October), schedule deliveries for **early morning** when possible
- Never leave wine in an unrefrigerated vehicle for more than 15 minutes
- If delivery cannot be completed, return stock to climate-controlled storage immediately

### Large Orders (12+ cases)
- Require **24-hour advance notice** for pick & pack
- May require multiple delivery trips — coordinate with customer on timing
- Kyle to oversee warehouse staging for large orders

### Returns & Issues
- Customer reports issue → Tallyn logs in Cin7 as a **Credit Note**
- Damaged/corked bottles: replace immediately from stock, no questions asked
- Wrong items delivered: schedule same-day correction delivery
- All issues escalated to Kyle; pattern issues reported to Dwayne weekly

---

## 8. Key Performance Indicators

| Metric | Target | Measured By |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| Order acknowledgment time | < 30 min (WhatsApp/phone), < 1 hr (email) | Tallyn |
| Order accuracy rate | > 99% | Quality check log |
| On-time delivery rate | > 95% | Cin7 delivery data |
| Customer satisfaction (follow-up) | > 4.5/5 | Roberto's feedback log |
| Average order-to-delivery time | Same day or next day | Cin7 reporting |
| Return/issue rate | < 1% | Credit note tracking |

---

## 9. Systems & Tools

| System | Purpose | Primary User |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| Cin7 Core | Inventory management, sales orders, invoicing | Tallyn, Kyle |
| Shopify | E-commerce storefront, online orders | Auto-sync to Cin7 |
| WhatsApp Business | Customer communication, order intake | Roberto, Tallyn |
| Google Workspace | Email, internal documents | All team |

---

## 10. Document Control

| Version | Date | Author | Changes |
|---------|------|--------|---------|
| 1.0 | February 2026 | 7 Cellars Operations | Initial release |

---

*This SOP is a living document. Review quarterly or when systems/processes change. All staff should be trained on this procedure before handling orders independently.*

files.name: Purchasing Guardrails
files.content:
# 7 Cellars — Wine Purchasing Guardrails & SOP

*Effective: February 2026*
*Applies to: All new wine purchases (Roberto, Dwayne, or any buyer)*

---

## Purpose

Every bottle we import represents our brand. This SOP ensures we're buying wines that are commercially viable, critically respected, and strategically positioned — not just wines that taste good to one person.

---

## Process: Before Any Order Is Placed

### Step 1: Roberto Submits Purchase Request
Roberto sends the proposed wine list to Dwayne (via Telegram, email, or shared sheet) with:
- Producer name
- Wine name & vintage
- Grape variety
- Region
- Proposed cost price
- Proposed order quantity
- Why he wants it (1-2 sentences)

### Step 2: Mika Runs the Data Check (~10 minutes)
For each wine on the list, Mika researches and reports:

| Check | What We're Looking For |
|-------|----------------------|
| **Vivino Score** | Rating (X.X/5) + number of ratings |
| **Critic Scores** | Wine Spectator, James Suckling, Parker, Jeb Dunnuck |
| **Market Pricing** | wine.com, wine-searcher avg retail |
| **Competitor Check** | Does Jacques Scott, Island Supply, or Blackbeard already carry it? |
| **Margin Analysis** | Our cost vs proposed retail — does it hit target margin? |
| **Portfolio Fit** | Do we already have something similar? Does it fill a gap? |

### Step 3: Dwayne Reviews the Report
Dwayne (or partners) review the data and approve/reject/modify the order.

---

## Minimum Standards

### Tier 1: Premium Portfolio (Retail $40+)
- Vivino ≥ 3.9/5 OR critic score ≥ 90 pts
- Not widely available on-island (differentiation matters)
- Minimum gross margin 40%
- Producer story or unique angle for marketing

### Tier 2: Mid-Range (Retail $20-40)
- Vivino ≥ 3.7/5 OR critic score ≥ 88 pts
- Strong food-pairing versatility (restaurant/hotel appeal)
- Minimum gross margin 35%

### Tier 3: Value/Volume (Retail under $20)
- Vivino ≥ 3.5/5 with 1,000+ ratings (proven market demand)
- Price-competitive vs on-island alternatives
- Minimum gross margin 30%
- High turnover potential (everyday drinking wines)

### Exceptions
Roberto can request exceptions for:
- **Boutique/Artisan wines** with limited Vivino data — must have strong critic backing (88+) or compelling producer story
- **Exclusive allocations** — limited production wines that add prestige to the portfolio
- **Client requests** — specific wines requested by hotel/restaurant accounts

All exceptions require a written justification and Dwayne's approval.

---

## Red Flags (Auto-Reject Unless Justified)

- ❌ Vivino below 3.4/5 with 500+ ratings (market has spoken)
- ❌ No critic scores AND low Vivino — unproven wine
- ❌ Already carried by 2+ competitors on-island
- ❌ Gross margin below 25%
- ❌ Overlaps with existing portfolio wine at same price point
- ❌ Producer with quality/consistency issues (check recent vintage variation)

---

## Portfolio Balance Targets

| Category | Target % of Portfolio | Current Status |
|----------|----------------------|----------------|
| Red Wine | 45-50% | TBD |
| White Wine | 25-30% | TBD |
| Sparkling/Champagne | 10-15% | TBD |
| Rosé | 5-10% | TBD |
| Dessert/Fortified | 3-5% | TBD |

| Price Tier | Target % | Notes |
|-----------|----------|-------|
| Premium ($40+) | 30-40% | Margin drivers, brand builders |
| Mid-Range ($20-40) | 40-50% | Volume + margin sweet spot |
| Value (under $20) | 10-20% | Traffic drivers, entry point |

| Region | Strategy |
|--------|----------|
| France | Core strength — maintain deep selection |
| Italy | Core strength — expand Piedmont & Southern |
| Spain | Growth opportunity — underrepresented |
| California/USA | New addition — build selectively |
| New World (Chile, Argentina, Australia, NZ) | Opportunistic — fill gaps |

---

## Reorder Decision Framework

When a wine sells through:
- **Sold out in < 60 days** → Reorder immediately, consider increasing quantity
- **Sold out in 60-120 days** → Reorder same quantity
- **Sold out in 120-180 days** → Reorder reduced quantity, evaluate pricing
- **Still in stock after 180 days** → Do not reorder. Discount to clear. Review why it didn't move.

---

## Seasonal Considerations (Grand Cayman)

- **Nov-Apr (High Season):** Stock up on premium wines — tourist spending peaks
- **May-Oct (Low Season):** Focus on value wines, rosé, easy-drinking whites
- **December:** Champagne & gift-worthy bottles — order by October
- **Spring:** Rosé season — order by February

---

*This SOP is a living document. Update as we learn what sells and what doesn't.*
*Roberto's palate + Mika's data = smarter buying decisions.*

files.name: Restaurant Onboarding Sop
files.content:
# Restaurant Account Onboarding

## Purpose

This SOP defines the end-to-end process for onboarding new restaurant accounts — from first contact through ongoing management. Every touchpoint reinforces 7 Cellars' white-glove positioning: personalized service, sommelier-led expertise, and proactive account care that no other distributor on Grand Cayman provides.

---

## Overview

| Phase | Timeline | Owner |
|-------|----------|-------|
| 1. Prospecting & Lead Identification | Ongoing | Roberto Logioia |
| 2. Initial Outreach | Day 1 | Roberto |
| 3. First Meeting & Tasting | Days 3–7 | Roberto |
| 4. Menu Analysis & Pairing Recommendations | Days 7–14 | Roberto |
| 5. Account Setup in Cin7 | Days 10–14 | Operations |
| 6. First Order & Delivery | Days 14–21 | Operations + Roberto |
| 7. Staff Training Session | Days 21–30 | Roberto |
| 8. Ongoing Relationship Management | Continuous | Roberto + Operations |
| 9. Quarterly Reviews | Every 90 days | Roberto |
| 10. Event Support | As needed | Full team |

---

## Phase 1: Prospecting & Lead Identification

**Objective:** Build and maintain a pipeline of high-value restaurant accounts across Grand Cayman.

### Target Account List

**Luxury Hotels & Resorts:**
- Ritz-Carlton — Seven, Silver Rain, Bar Jack
- Kimpton Seafire — Coccoloba, Ave

**Fine Dining & Upscale Casual:**
- Blue by Eric Ripert
- Luca
- The Brasserie
- Agua
- Pappagallo

**Popular Dining & Waterfront:**
- Kaibo
- The Wharf
- Tillies

### Lead Identification Actions

- Monitor new restaurant openings, chef arrivals, and menu refreshes via local press and social media
- Track competitor activity — note accounts underserved by Jacques Scott or other distributors
- Attend food & beverage industry events on-island
- Leverage existing relationships for warm introductions
- Review hotel F&B director announcements and sommelier hires
- Maintain a prospect tracker with contact details, current supplier, estimated monthly volume, and next action date

### Qualification Criteria

| Criteria | Minimum Threshold |
|----------|------------------|
| Monthly wine spend | CI$1,500+ |
| Menu complexity | Wine list or pairing program |
| Brand alignment | Premium positioning or aspirational |
| Decision-maker access | Direct line to F&B director, chef, or owner |

---

## Phase 2: Initial Outreach

**Objective:** Secure a first meeting by communicating the 7 Cellars value proposition clearly and personally.

### Outreach Approach

1. **Identify the decision-maker** — F&B director, head sommelier, executive chef, or owner
2. **Personalize the message** — Reference their menu, a specific wine that would complement their cuisine, or a mutual connection
3. **Choose the channel** — In-person visit preferred; phone call or personalized email/WhatsApp as alternatives
4. **Lead with value, not a pitch:**
   - "I noticed your seafood menu — we just brought in a Chablis Premier Cru that would be stunning with your ceviche"
   - "We'd love to do a complimentary tasting for your team — no commitment, just great wine"

### Outreach Template (Email/WhatsApp)

> Hi [Name],
>
> I'm Roberto Logioia, Sommelier and Director of Sales at 7 Cellars. We're a boutique wine and spirits distributor here on Grand Cayman, and I've been admiring what you're doing at [Restaurant].
>
> I'd love to stop by and share a few bottles I think would work beautifully with your menu — completely complimentary, no strings attached. We pride ourselves on hands-on, personalized service — think of us as an extension of your team rather than just a supplier.
>
> Would [suggest two specific days] work for a quick tasting? Happy to work around your schedule.
>
> Cheers,
> Roberto

### Follow-Up Cadence

| Day | Action |
|-----|--------|
| Day 0 | Initial outreach |
| Day 3 | Follow-up if no response (different channel) |
| Day 7 | Second follow-up with a specific value offer |
| Day 14 | Final touch — offer to drop off a sample bottle |
| Day 30+ | Add to nurture list, revisit quarterly |

---

## Phase 3: First Meeting & Tasting

**Objective:** Build rapport, understand the restaurant's needs, and demonstrate 7 Cellars' expertise through a curated tasting.

### Preparation Checklist

- [ ] Research the restaurant's current wine list (visit, check website, ask contacts)
- [ ] Review the food menu in detail — note flavor profiles, key dishes, price points
- [ ] Select 4–6 wines that address gaps or elevate their current offering
- [ ] Prepare tasting notes for each wine (printed, branded cards)
- [ ] Bring 7 Cellars portfolio overview (printed or tablet)
- [ ] Bring branded materials: business cards, table talker samples, menu pairing card samples
- [ ] Confirm meeting time and attendees

### Meeting Structure (45–60 minutes)

1. **Introduction** (5 min) — Roberto's background, 7 Cellars story, white-glove service philosophy
2. **Discovery** (10 min) — Ask about their current program:
   - What's working? What's not?
   - Pain points with current supplier (delivery reliability, communication, selection)?
   - Upcoming menu changes or events?
   - Who selects wines — chef, owner, sommelier?
   - Average bottle price point on their list?
3. **Guided Tasting** (25 min) — Walk through each wine:
   - Origin, producer story, winemaking approach
   - Specific pairing suggestions tied to *their* menu items
   - Price positioning relative to their current list
4. **Service Differentiators** (10 min) — Explain what makes 7 Cellars different:
   - Proactive reorder management (par level tracking, text reminders)
   - Complimentary staff training sessions
   - Branded table talkers, menu pairing cards, wine list inserts
   - Quarterly menu pairing reviews
   - Event support for private events
5. **Next Steps** (5 min) — Agree on follow-up action:
   - Full menu analysis and pairing proposal
   - Sample delivery for kitchen team
   - Second tasting with broader team

### Post-Meeting Actions

- Send thank-you message within 24 hours
- Include photos of wines tasted (for reference)
- Note all preferences, constraints, and opportunities in the prospect tracker
- Begin menu analysis if meeting was positive

---

## Phase 4: Menu Analysis & Pairing Recommendations

**Objective:** Deliver a customized wine program proposal that demonstrates deep understanding of the restaurant's cuisine and clientele.

### Analysis Process

1. **Obtain the full food menu** — current and any planned seasonal updates
2. **Map each dish category** to ideal wine styles:
   - Appetizers / starters
   - Seafood
   - Meat / poultry
   - Pasta / risotto
   - Desserts
3. **Build a pairing matrix:**

| Menu Item | Current Wine | Recommended Wine | Why | BTG / Bottle | Price to Restaurant |
|-----------|-------------|-----------------|-----|-------------|-------------------|
| Ceviche | House Sauv Blanc | Domaine Laroche Chablis | Mineral, citrus, elevates the dish | BTG | $XX |
| Wagyu Steak | Cabernet (generic) | Château X Saint-Émilion | Structure, terroir story | Bottle | $XX |

4. **Consider the wine list structure:**
   - By-the-glass selections (5–8 wines, high-margin, versatile)
   - Bottle list organized by style or region
   - Reserve / cellar selections for special occasions
   - Cocktail / spirits integration where applicable
5. **Price positioning** — Ensure recommendations fit their target price points (2.5–4x markup standard)
6. **Prepare the proposal document** — Clean, branded PDF with:
   - Executive summary
   - Pairing matrix
   - Suggested wine list layout
   - Pricing schedule
   - Staff training plan

### Delivery

- Present in person where possible — walk through the proposal
- Leave behind printed and digital copies
- Invite feedback and iteration before finalizing

---

## Phase 5: Account Setup in Cin7

**Objective:** Create the customer record and ensure smooth operational onboarding.

### Cin7 Setup Checklist

- [ ] Create new customer record in Cin7
  - Legal business name
  - Trade name (restaurant name)
  - Physical address (delivery address)
  - Billing address (if different)
  - Primary contact: name, phone, email
  - Secondary contact (if applicable)
  - Trade license number
  - Liquor license number and expiry date
- [ ] Set payment terms (Net 15 / Net 30 — confirm with management)
- [ ] Assign price tier (standard, premium, volume)
- [ ] Set credit limit (confirm with management)
- [ ] Configure delivery preferences:
  - Preferred delivery days
  - Delivery window (morning / afternoon)
  - Loading dock or front door
  - Contact person for deliveries
  - Special instructions (gate codes, service entrance, etc.)
- [ ] Add to appropriate customer group for reporting
- [ ] Set up par levels for initial product list (to be refined after first 60 days)

### Required Documents

- Signed customer agreement / credit application
- Copy of trade license
- Copy of liquor license
- Completed W-8BEN or tax form (if applicable)

---

## Phase 6: First Order & Delivery

**Objective:** Make the first delivery flawless — this sets the tone for the entire relationship.

### Pre-Delivery

- [ ] Confirm order details with the restaurant 48 hours before delivery
- [ ] Double-check all items are in stock
- [ ] Ensure proper storage temperature for delivery (whites/rosés chilled if requested)
- [ ] Prepare delivery with branded materials:
  - Wine spec sheets for each product
  - Table talkers (if applicable)
  - Menu pairing cards
  - Roberto's business card (if not already provided)
- [ ] Schedule delivery within the agreed window

### Delivery Day

- [ ] Roberto accompanies the first delivery personally
- [ ] Walk through each product with the receiving staff
- [ ] Confirm proper storage upon arrival (temperature, positioning)
- [ ] Review the order for accuracy with the contact person
- [ ] Discuss reorder process and par level tracking
- [ ] Set up preferred communication channel for reorders (text/WhatsApp/email)
- [ ] Leave behind any outstanding branded materials

### Post-Delivery Follow-Up

- [ ] Send confirmation message: "Everything arrive in good shape? Let me know if you need anything"
- [ ] Check in after first weekend of service — how are the wines performing?
- [ ] Note any immediate feedback or adjustments needed
- [ ] Update par levels in Cin7 based on initial sell-through

---

## Phase 7: Staff Training Session

**Objective:** Empower front-of-house staff to sell confidently and tell the story behind each wine.

### Training Format

- **Duration:** 30–60 minutes
- **Led by:** Roberto Logioia
- **Audience:** All FOH staff (servers, bartenders, hosts, managers)
- **Timing:** Pre-shift (before lunch or dinner service)
- **Cost:** Complimentary

### Training Agenda

1. **Introduction to 7 Cellars** (5 min)
   - Who we are and how we support the restaurant
   - How to reach us for questions or reorders
2. **Wine Fundamentals Refresher** (10 min, adjust to audience level)
   - Key grape varieties on the list
   - How to read a wine label
   - Basic tasting vocabulary for guest-facing descriptions
3. **Guided Tasting of Key Wines** (20–30 min)
   - Taste 4–6 featured wines
   - For each wine: one-sentence story, two food pairings, one selling phrase
   - Example: "This is a family-owned Barolo from Piedmont — it's incredible with the lamb shank, and guests who love bold reds will be blown away"
4. **Upselling Techniques** (10 min)
   - Moving guests from house wine to a recommended pour
   - Suggesting a bottle when a table orders multiple glasses
   - Pairing suggestions as a natural part of service
5. **Q&A** (5 min)

### Training Materials Provided

- Printed tasting cards for each wine (pocket-sized for apron reference)
- Quick-reference pairing guide (laminated, for behind the bar)
- Digital versions sent to the restaurant manager for new hire onboarding

### Follow-Up

- Offer to return for refresher training with seasonal menu changes
- Provide ongoing support for new hire training
- Track training dates and attendees

---

## Phase 8: Ongoing Relationship Management

**Objective:** Maintain consistent, proactive communication that reinforces 7 Cellars as an indispensable partner — not just a vendor.

### Proactive Reorder Management

This is a core differentiator. Do not wait for the restaurant to call.

1. **Establish par levels** for each product (based on first 60 days of data)
2. **Track consumption** via Cin7 order history and delivery frequency
3. **Text or WhatsApp** the contact person when stock approaches reorder point:
   - "Hey [Name], looks like you're getting low on the Sancerre — want me to add it to Thursday's delivery?"
4. **Adjust par levels** seasonally and based on performance data
5. **Flag slow-moving items** — suggest replacements before they become dead stock

### Communication Cadence

| Frequency | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| Weekly | Reorder check / delivery confirmation |
| Bi-weekly | Quick check-in call or visit (5–10 min) |
| Monthly | Introduce 1–2 new products relevant to their menu |
| Quarterly | Full menu pairing review (see Phase 9) |
| As needed | Event support, special requests, urgent deliveries |

### Relationship Touchpoints

- Share new arrivals and limited allocations with priority accounts first
- Invite key contacts to 7 Cellars tastings and industry events
- Remember personal details — birthdays, anniversaries, career milestones
- Send holiday gifts or special bottles during festive season
- Offer exclusive first-pour opportunities for new wines

---

## Phase 9: Quarterly Menu Pairing Reviews

**Objective:** Keep the wine program fresh, aligned with menu evolution, and performing at peak revenue.

### Review Process

1. **Schedule in advance** — Book the quarterly review at the end of each prior session
2. **Prepare a performance report:**
   - Top sellers (volume and revenue)
   - Underperformers (low velocity, consider replacement)
   - Margin analysis by category
   - Comparison to prior quarter
3. **Review upcoming menu changes** — New dishes, seasonal shifts, chef specials
4. **Propose adjustments:**
   - New wines to match menu changes
   - BTG rotation to keep the program interesting
   - Price adjustments based on market or cost changes
   - Promotional opportunities (wine dinner, featured pairing)
5. **Conduct a focused tasting** of proposed new additions
6. **Update Cin7** — Adjust product list, par levels, and pricing

### Quarterly Review Template

| Category | Current Selection | Recommendation | Rationale |
|----------|------------------|---------------|-----------|
| BTG White | [Wine A] | [Wine B] | Seasonal refresh, better margin |
| BTG Red | [Wine C] | Keep | Strong performer |
| Reserve | [Wine D] | [Wine E] | Menu pairing for new entrée |

---

## Phase 10: Event Support

**Objective:** Position 7 Cellars as the go-to partner for private events, wine dinners, and special occasions.

### Event Services Offered

- **Wine dinner curation** — Multi-course pairing menus with tasting notes for guests
- **Private event supply** — Custom orders with flexible delivery scheduling
- **On-site sommelier support** — Roberto available for guided tastings or table-side service at premium events
- **Branded materials** — Custom menu cards, table talkers, and event collateral
- **Corporate event packages** — Curated selections for corporate entertaining

### Event Support Process

1. Restaurant contacts Roberto with event details (date, format, guest count, budget)
2. Roberto proposes a wine selection and pairing menu within 48 hours
3. Collaborate with the chef on pairings and tasting note language
4. Confirm order and delivery logistics at least 7 days before the event
5. Deliver with event-specific materials (printed menus, branded elements)
6. Roberto attends if requested for sommelier-led components
7. Post-event follow-up — feedback, photos for social media (with permission), learnings for future events

---

## Account Health Metrics

**Objective:** Track the health and growth of each restaurant account using data-driven indicators.

### Key Performance Indicators

| Metric | Target | Frequency |
|--------|--------|-----------|
| Monthly order value | Growing or stable QoQ | Monthly |
| Order frequency | Minimum 2x per month | Monthly |
| Product mix breadth | 5+ unique SKUs | Quarterly |
| BTG wine rotation | At least 1 new wine per quarter | Quarterly |
| Staff training sessions | Minimum 2 per year | Semi-annual |
| Quarterly review completion | 100% of active accounts | Quarterly |
| Payment terms compliance | Within agreed terms | Monthly |
| NPS / satisfaction score | 8+ (informal check-in) | Semi-annual |

### Account Health Tiers

| Tier | Criteria | Action |
|------|----------|--------|
| 🟢 Healthy | Growing orders, engaged contact, on-time payments | Maintain cadence, reward loyalty |
| 🟡 At Risk | Declining orders, slow communication, late payments | Increase touchpoints, schedule review meeting |
| 🔴 Critical | No orders in 30+ days, unresponsive, payment issues | Escalate — Roberto personal visit, management review |

### Monthly Account Review

Roberto reviews all active accounts monthly:
- Flag any accounts moving from green to yellow
- Identify upsell opportunities in healthy accounts
- Document competitive threats (other distributors making inroads)
- Update the prospect pipeline with new leads from existing relationships

---

## Appendix: Branded Materials Checklist

| Material | Purpose | Provided |
|----------|---------|----------|
| Table talkers | Wine features at the table | Complimentary |
| Menu pairing cards | Suggested pairings for servers | Complimentary |
| Wine list inserts | Branded wine descriptions | Complimentary |
| Tasting cards | Staff training reference | Complimentary |
| Quick-reference guide | Behind-the-bar cheat sheet | Complimentary |
| Event menu cards | Wine dinner / event collateral | Complimentary |

---

## Appendix: Key Contacts

| Role | Name | Contact |
|------|------|---------|
| Sommelier & Director of Sales | Roberto Logioia | roberto@7cellars.ky |
| Operations / Cin7 | [TBD] | — |
| Delivery Coordination | [TBD] | — |

---

*This SOP is a living document. Review and update quarterly or as processes evolve.*

# Roberto's Client Blitz — 7 Cellars Rebrand Announcement

## The Message

Roberto sends this to every existing Vino Veritas client — restaurants, hotels, bars, retail accounts, private clients. Personalized slightly for each type.

---

## Email Version (from info@7cellars.ky)

**Subject: Exciting News — Vino Veritas is Now 7 Cellars**

---

Dear [Name],

I'm excited to share some news — Vino Veritas has evolved into **7 Cellars**.

Same passion for exceptional wine. Same personal service you've come to expect from me. But with a bigger vision, stronger partnerships, and an expanded portfolio to serve you even better.

**What's changing:**
- 🍷 **More selection** — We're expanding with premium spirits, curated specialty products, and even more world-class wines to complement the portfolio you already know
- 🚗 **Same white-glove delivery** — Free across Grand Cayman, on your schedule
- 🌐 **New website** — Browse and order at **www.7cellars.ky**
- 📱 **Easier ordering** — WhatsApp, phone, email, or online

**What's NOT changing:**
- Your pricing stays the same
- I'm still your personal contact for everything
- The same wines you know and love are all still here

**Updated contact info:**
- 📧 info@7cellars.ky
- 📞 (345) 526-8466
- 🌐 www.7cellars.ky

I'd love to schedule a quick visit to walk you through our new offerings. What day works best this week?

Cheers,

**Roberto Logioia**
Sommelier, Director of Sales
7 Cellars | Wine and Spirits

---

## WhatsApp Version (shorter, personal)

**For restaurant/hotel accounts:**

```
Hi [Name]! 👋

Quick update — Vino Veritas is now 7 Cellars 🍷

Same wines, same me, same service — but we're growing! More selection, new website, and an even better experience for our partners.

Your pricing and everything stays the same. I'd love to pop by this week to show you what's new.

When works for a quick visit?

Roberto | 7 Cellars
www.7cellars.ky
```

**For private/retail clients:**

```
Hi [Name]! 👋

Exciting news — Vino Veritas has become 7 Cellars! 🍷✨

All your favourite wines are still here, plus we're expanding into premium spirits and curated selections.

Check out our new site: www.7cellars.ky

Same personal service, same delivery — just a fresh look and more to offer. Let me know if you'd like any recommendations!

Roberto | 7 Cellars
(345) 526-8466
```

---

## Roberto's Blitz Checklist

### Week 1: Top Accounts (Priority A)
Send personalized email + WhatsApp to each. Schedule in-person visits.

| # | Action | Target |
|---|--------|--------|
| 1 | Email + WhatsApp + visit | Top 10 restaurant accounts |
| 2 | Email + WhatsApp + visit | Top 5 hotel accounts |
| 3 | Email + WhatsApp | Top private clients (big spenders) |
| 4 | Email + WhatsApp + visit | Any accounts at risk of switching |

### Week 2: All Active Accounts
Send email to all remaining active accounts. WhatsApp follow-up 2 days later.

| # | Action | Target |
|---|--------|--------|
| 5 | Bulk email (personalized greeting) | All restaurant accounts |
| 6 | Bulk email (personalized greeting) | All hotel/bar accounts |
| 7 | WhatsApp | All private clients |
| 8 | WhatsApp | Yacht/villa contacts |

### Week 3: New Prospects
Use the prospect list to reach out to accounts that were NOT Vino Veritas clients.

| # | Action | Target |
|---|--------|--------|
| 9 | Cold email + WhatsApp | Priority A prospects from CRM list |
| 10 | Schedule tastings | Restaurants interested in wine list updates |

---

## Tracking

Roberto updates the prospect list spreadsheet after each contact:
- **Status:** Active / Contacted / Meeting Scheduled / Won / Lost
- **Last Contact Date**
- **Notes:** What was discussed, next steps

---

## Email Blast Option

If Roberto wants to send the announcement to ALL clients at once:

1. Export client email list from existing records
2. I compose the email in info@7cellars.ky
3. BCC all recipients (or use individual sends for top accounts)
4. Personal WhatsApp follow-up to key accounts within 48hrs

**Recommended: Personal emails to top 20, then bulk for the rest.**

---

## Key Talking Points for In-Person Visits

Roberto should hit these in every meeting:

1. **"Same Roberto, bigger team"** — New partners investing in growth
2. **"Your pricing is locked"** — No changes to existing arrangements
3. **"What are you missing?"** — Ask what they wish they could get that they currently can't → feeds product expansion
4. **"Tastings on us"** — Offer a complimentary staff tasting for restaurant partners
5. **"Check out the new site"** — Show www.7cellars.ky on his phone
6. **"Refer a friend"** — Ask for introductions to other businesses

---

*This blitz should take 2-3 weeks to fully execute. Top accounts get personal attention first, then cascade to everyone else.*

files.name: Tasting Event Playbook
files.content:
# Event Types

## Intimate Tastings (10–15 Guests)
- **Format:** Seated, guided tasting with Roberto leading
- **Duration:** 90 minutes
- **Setting:** Private dining room, villa terrace, yacht salon
- **Ideal for:** UHNW residents, couples' evenings, birthday celebrations
- **Wine flight:** 5–6 wines with paired bites
- **Price point:** $95–$125 per person

## Large Format Events (30–50 Guests)
- **Format:** Standing reception with tasting stations + seated guided segment
- **Duration:** 2–2.5 hours
- **Setting:** Hotel ballroom, restaurant event space, beach club
- **Ideal for:** Product launches, seasonal celebrations, charity partnerships
- **Wine flight:** 4–5 wines at stations, plus a featured pour
- **Price point:** $75–$95 per person

## Corporate Private Events
- **Format:** Fully customized to client objectives (team building, client entertainment, board dinners)
- **Duration:** 1.5–3 hours depending on format
- **Setting:** Client's office, partner venue, private villa
- **Ideal for:** Law firms, hedge funds, family offices, real estate groups
- **Wine flight:** Curated to budget and preferences
- **Price point:** Flat fee $2,500–$7,500 (includes all wine, food, service)

## Restaurant Staff Training
- **Format:** Educational workshop — blind tasting, varietal identification, selling techniques
- **Duration:** 60–90 minutes (before service)
- **Setting:** Partner restaurant (private or closed dining room)
- **Ideal for:** Building knowledge among restaurant partners who carry 7 Cellars wines
- **Wine flight:** 4–6 wines from the 7 Cellars portfolio they stock
- **Price point:** Complimentary or cost-recovery ($500–$1,000) — investment in the relationship

## Yacht & Villa Private Experiences
- **Format:** White-glove, fully portable tasting brought to the client
- **Duration:** 1.5–2 hours
- **Setting:** Client's yacht or private villa
- **Ideal for:** Charter guests, visiting UHNW, celebratory occasions
- **Wine flight:** Premium selections (Champagne, Barolo, Brunello)
- **Price point:** $150+ per person or flat fee starting at $3,000
- **Notes:** Requires advance coordination for glassware transport, ice, and setup crew

---

# Planning Timeline

## 4 Weeks Out
- Confirm event type, guest count estimate, and venue
- Select wine flight (Roberto curates based on theme/season)
- Set pricing and determine if partner-sponsored
- Create event listing for promotion (photo, copy, details)
- Begin promotion: Instagram post, WhatsApp broadcast, email to VIP list

## 3 Weeks Out
- Finalize food pairings — confirm availability of cheeses, charcuterie, specialty items
- Order any wines not currently in stock (allow for shipping to Cayman)
- Confirm venue logistics: table layout, AV needs, parking, access
- Launch ticket sales or RSVP tracking (Google Form, Eventbrite, or direct WhatsApp)

## 2 Weeks Out
- Second promotional push: Instagram story, reminder email, WhatsApp follow-up
- Confirm RSVPs and begin waitlist if needed
- Finalize staffing: pouring assistants, food prep, photographer
- Print any materials: tasting cards, menus, branded collateral

## 1 Week Out
- Final guest count confirmed
- All wines pulled and stored at correct temperature
- Food order placed with suppliers
- Confirm photographer and social media coverage plan
- Prepare Roberto's talking points and tasting order

## Day Before
- Pre-chill whites and sparkling (Prosecco, Champagne)
- Prep food platters (cheese tempering schedule, charcuterie slicing)
- Pack and transport: glassware, ice, linens, printed materials, signage
- Charge any AV equipment, test playlist/ambient music

## Day Of (See Day-of Execution section for full detail)
- Arrive 2 hours before guests
- Complete setup and staging
- Roberto final run-through of presentation
- Doors open, welcome guests, begin service

---

# Venue Selection & Setup

## Venue Requirements
| Requirement | Minimum Standard |
|---|---|
| **Capacity** | 1.5x guest count for comfort |
| **Temperature** | Air-conditioned to 68–72°F (critical for wine integrity) |
| **Lighting** | Dimmable preferred; warm tones, no harsh fluorescent |
| **Surface area** | Enough table space for glassware + food plates per guest |
| **Access** | Easy load-in for wine cases, food supplies, glassware |
| **Restrooms** | Clean, accessible, adequate for guest count |
| **Parking/transport** | Valet or dedicated parking; walkable from drop-off |
| **Sound** | Quiet enough for Roberto's presentation without a microphone (under 30 guests) or PA system available |

## Preferred Venue Types on Grand Cayman
- **7 Cellars retail space** (future) — intimate home-base tastings
- **Partner restaurant private rooms** — Agua, Lobster Pot, Blue by Eric Ripert, Kaibo
- **Yacht clubs** — Cayman Islands Yacht Club
- **Hotel event spaces** — Ritz-Carlton, Kimpton Seafire, Westin
- **Private villas** — client-provided, Seven Mile Beach or South Sound

## Table Layout

**Seated tastings (10–15):**
- Single long table, family-style — creates intimacy
- Each place setting: 4–6 glasses arranged left to right (tasting order), water glass, tasting card, napkin
- Food plates served centrally or individually plated

**Standing tastings (30–50):**
- 3–4 tasting stations, each featuring 1–2 wines with paired food
- High-top tables scattered for guests to set glasses
- One focal station where Roberto delivers remarks

## Glassware
- **Minimum:** One glass per wine in flight (no reuse during tasting)
- **Preferred:** Riedel or Schott Zwiesel universal wine glasses
- **Sparkling:** Flute or tulip glass for Prosecco/Champagne
- **Quantity math:** Guests × wines in flight + 20% backup = total glasses needed
- **Example:** 15 guests × 5 wines = 75 glasses + 15 backup = 90 glasses

## Temperature Guide
| Wine Type | Serving Temp | Prep |
|---|---|---|
| Sparkling (Prosecco, Champagne) | 40–45°F | Ice bath 30 min before service |
| White / Rosé | 45–50°F | Refrigerate; pull 10 min before pour |
| Light Red (Chianti, Languedoc) | 55–60°F | Cool room or brief chill |
| Full Red (Barolo, Brunello) | 60–65°F | Room temp in Cayman AC environment |

---

# Wine Selection

## Curating a Flight
Roberto selects wines based on three principles:

1. **Tell a story** — Every flight has a narrative (a region, a grape, a theme, a journey)
2. **Build complexity** — Start light and fresh, finish bold and complex
3. **Showcase the portfolio** — Feature wines guests can purchase from 7 Cellars

## Flight Structures

### The Classic Journey (5 wines)
1. **Sparkling opener** — Prosecco or Champagne (palate awakener)
2. **White** — Burgundy Chardonnay or crisp white from Languedoc
3. **Light red** — Chianti Classico or Languedoc blend
4. **Medium red** — Montecucco Sangiovese or structured Chianti Riserva
5. **Bold finish** — Brunello di Montalcino or Barolo

### The Italian Experience (5 wines)
1. Prosecco — bright, celebratory start
2. Italian white (Vermentino or Gavi)
3. Chianti Classico — the everyday elegance
4. Montecucco Sangiovese — the discovery wine
5. Brunello di Montalcino — the grand finale

### The French Affair (5 wines)
1. Champagne — nothing else opens like it
2. White Burgundy — Chardonnay at its purest
3. Languedoc red blend — value and character
4. Burgundy Pinot Noir — terroir in a glass
5. Prestige cuvée or aged Burgundy — the showstopper

### Food & Wine Pairing Flight (6 wines + 6 bites)
1. Prosecco + aged Parmigiano-Reggiano
2. White Burgundy + truffle-infused cheese
3. Languedoc rosé + prosciutto and melon
4. Chianti + pecorino and fig jam
5. Brunello + 36-month aged Comté with truffle honey
6. Late-harvest or dessert pour + dark chocolate with olive oil and sea salt

## Tasting Order Rules
- Always light → bold
- Dry before sweet
- White before red (except when a bold white follows a light red for educational contrast)
- Sparkling always first
- Never more than 6 wines — palate fatigue is real

## Pour Sizes
- **Tasting pour:** 2 oz per wine (standard)
- **Generous pour:** 3 oz per wine (intimate/premium events)
- **Bottle math:** One 750ml bottle = twelve 2-oz pours or eight 3-oz pours

---

# Food Pairing

## Pairing Matrix

| Wine | Cheese | Charcuterie | Other |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Prosecco** | Parmigiano-Reggiano (24-month) | Prosciutto di Parma | Marcona almonds, breadsticks |
| **Champagne** | Triple-crème Brie | Smoked salmon | Blinis, crème fraîche |
| **White Burgundy** | Comté, Gruyère | — | Truffle oil crostini, roasted hazelnuts |
| **Languedoc Red** | Manchego, aged Gouda | Saucisson sec | Olive tapenade, roasted peppers |
| **Chianti** | Pecorino Toscano | Bresaola | Fig jam, grissini |
| **Montecucco** | Aged pecorino | Finocchiona | Honey, dried apricots |
| **Brunello** | 36-month Parmigiano | Culatello | Truffle honey, dark chocolate |
| **Barolo** | Castelmagno, Robiola | Lardo | Truffle shavings, aged balsamic drizzle |

## Plating & Presentation
- **Individual boards:** For seated tastings — each guest receives a personal pairing board
- **Shared platters:** For standing events — large slate or wooden boards at each station
- **Labeling:** Every cheese and meat labeled with name and origin
- **Garnish:** Fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme), edible flowers, fruit (figs, grapes)
- **Olive oil station:** Premium EVOO with bread for dipping, labeled by region
- **Balsamic station:** Aged balsamic (12+ year) drizzled on Parmigiano chunks

## Sourcing Notes
- Cheeses: Import via 7 Cellars specialty food supply chain
- Charcuterie: Source from Italian specialty suppliers (same logistics as wine imports)
- Bread and crackers: Partner with local bakery or import artisan crackers
- Fresh fruit and herbs: Source locally on Grand Cayman where possible

---

# Roberto's Presentation Guide

## The Opening (5 minutes)
- Welcome guests warmly — first names where possible
- Introduce yourself: "I'm Roberto Logioia, Sommelier and Director of Sales at 7 Cellars"
- Set the tone: "Tonight is about discovery and enjoyment — no wrong answers"
- Brief overview of the flight: theme, number of wines, what to expect
- Housekeeping: "Use the dump bucket if needed — no judgment. Water is here to reset your palate."

## Leading Each Pour (5–7 minutes per wine)
1. **Introduce the wine** — Name, producer, region, vintage
2. **Tell the story** — Where does this wine come from? Who makes it? What makes it special?
3. **Guide the tasting:**
   - "Look at the color — what do you notice?"
   - "Swirl and smell — what comes to mind?"
   - "Now taste — let it sit on your palate"
4. **Share your tasting notes** — Keep it relatable, not pretentious. "I get ripe cherry, a little leather, and this beautiful earthy finish"
5. **Introduce the food pairing** — "Now try it with the pecorino — notice how the salt lifts the fruit"
6. **Invite reaction** — "What are you getting? Anyone taste something different?"

## Engagement Techniques
- **Ask questions** — "Who's had Brunello before?" "Anyone been to Tuscany?"
- **Use comparisons** — "Think of this as the Italian equivalent of..."
- **Tell personal stories** — Roberto's experiences visiting producers, harvest memories
- **Encourage interaction between guests** — "Turn to your neighbor, compare notes"
- **Keep it light** — Humor is welcome. Wine should be fun, not intimidating.

## Handling Questions
- **Encourage all questions** — There are no dumb questions at a 7 Cellars event
- **"I don't know"** is fine — "Great question, let me find out and get back to you" builds trust
- **Redirect tangents gently** — "Love that topic — let's come back to it after the tasting"
- **Price questions:** "All of tonight's wines are available through 7 Cellars — I'll share our list at the end"

## The Close (5 minutes)
- Recap the flight — highlights and personal favorites
- Mention upcoming events and the 7 Cellars wine club / VIP list
- Thank guests genuinely
- "All the wines and food products you tasted tonight are available through 7 Cellars — here's how to order"
- Circulate business cards, collect contact info, take group photo

---

# Pricing Models

## Per-Person Ticketed Events

| Event Type | Price Range | Includes |
|---|---|---|
| Standard tasting (4–5 wines) | $75–$85 | Wines, light bites, guided tasting |
| Premium tasting (5–6 wines + full pairing) | $95–$125 | Premium wines, artisan food pairings, tasting card |
| Champagne & caviar experience | $125–$175 | Champagne flight, caviar, luxury bites |

## Corporate Flat Fee

| Package | Guest Count | Price |
|---|---|---|
| **Bronze** | Up to 15 | $2,500 |
| **Silver** | Up to 30 | $4,500 |
| **Gold** | Up to 50 | $7,500 |
| **Platinum (Villa/Yacht)** | Up to 20 | $5,000+ |

*All corporate packages include wines, food, Roberto's presentation, printed materials, and event photography.*

## Restaurant Partner Sponsored
- **Model:** Restaurant covers venue + food prep; 7 Cellars provides wine + expertise
- **Revenue split:** Ticket revenue shared 60/40 (7 Cellars / restaurant) or 50/50
- **Benefit for restaurant:** Draws new clientele, fills off-peak nights, positions them as a destination
- **Benefit for 7 Cellars:** No venue cost, built-in kitchen, cross-promotion to restaurant's database

## Add-Ons
| Add-On | Price |
|---|---|
| Professional event photography | $300–$500 |
| Custom branded tasting cards | $5/person |
| Take-home wine gift (1 bottle) | At cost + $10 |
| Private sommelier consultation (post-event) | $150/hour |

---

# Promotion

## Instagram (Primary Channel)
- **3 weeks out:** Announcement post with event details, stunning wine/food imagery
- **2 weeks out:** Story series — behind-the-scenes wine selection, food prep preview
- **1 week out:** "Limited spots remaining" urgency post
- **Day of:** Stories throughout setup and event
- **Post-event:** Photo carousel, guest testimonials, "you missed it" FOMO content
- **Always tag:** Venue partner, food producers, wine producers where applicable

## WhatsApp (Direct & Personal)
- **VIP list broadcast:** Personal invitation to existing customers and past attendees
- **Message template:** "Hi [Name], Roberto is hosting an exclusive [event name] on [date] at [venue]. Only [X] spots — would you like me to reserve yours?"
- **Follow-up:** Reminder 3 days before, day-of logistics message
- **Post-event:** Thank you message with photos and link to order wines tasted

## Email
- **To 7 Cellars customer database:** Designed HTML email with event details, booking link
- **Subject lines that work:** "You're Invited: An Evening with Barolo" / "Taste Tuscany on Grand Cayman"
- **Segment:** Past event attendees get early access; new contacts get FOMO-driven copy

## Restaurant Partner Cross-Promotion
- Partner restaurant promotes to their mailing list and social channels
- Co-branded event flyer displayed at restaurant
- Restaurant staff personally recommend to regulars
- Shared Instagram posts and stories

## Additional Channels
- **Concierge networks:** Hotel concierges at Ritz-Carlton, Kimpton, Westin — provide printed invitations
- **Yacht charter companies:** Leave flyers, build relationships with charter managers
- **Real estate agents:** High-end agents know UHNW new arrivals — mutual referral opportunity

---

# Day-of Execution

## T-minus 2 Hours: Arrival & Load-in
- Arrive at venue with all supplies
- Inventory check: wines (correct bottles and quantities), food, glassware, ice, linens, printed materials, signage
- Confirm AC is running and room temperature is correct

## T-minus 1.5 Hours: Setup
- **Tables:** Arrange per layout plan (see Venue section)
- **Place settings:** Glasses in tasting order (left to right), water glass, tasting card, napkin
- **Wine station:** Stage all bottles; open reds to breathe; chill whites and sparkling
- **Food station:** Arrange platters, label all items, set out olive oil and balsamic stations
- **Ambiance:** Set lighting (dim/warm), start background music (low-key jazz, classical, or Italian acoustic)
- **Signage:** 7 Cellars branded welcome sign, menu/flight card at entrance
- **Photography:** Brief photographer on key shots (setup, pours, guest reactions, food close-ups)

## T-minus 30 Minutes: Final Check
- Roberto walks the room — everything in place
- Test any AV equipment (microphone, playlist)
- Staff briefing: roles, timing, flow
- Water pitchers and dump buckets positioned
- Bathroom check

## Service Flow

| Time | Activity |
|---|---|
| 0:00 | Doors open — welcome guests with sparkling pour |
| 0:00–0:15 | Arrival and mingling — sparkling + light appetizers |
| 0:15 | Roberto welcomes, introduces the evening |
| 0:20–1:15 | Guided tasting — 5–6 wines with food pairings |
| 1:15–1:30 | Open discussion, Q&A, final pour |
| 1:30–1:45 | Closing remarks, business cards, wine list distribution |
| 1:45+ | Informal mingling, sales conversations, photo ops |

## Cleanup
- Begin clearing glasses and food as guests depart
- Collect all 7 Cellars materials and signage
- Settle venue invoice if applicable
- Pack remaining wine (note opened vs. unopened for inventory)
- Thank venue staff personally

---

# Post-Event

## Within 24 Hours
- **Thank you message:** WhatsApp or email to every attendee
  - "Thank you for joining us last night — it was a pleasure sharing these wines with you"
  - Include link to order wines tasted
  - Attach 1–2 best photos from the event
- **Contact capture:** Add all new contacts to 7 Cellars CRM / customer database
  - Tag: event attended, wines of interest, purchase intent

## Within 48 Hours
- **Social media post:** Instagram carousel — best 5–8 photos from the event
  - Caption: recap the evening, tag venue, tag attendees (with permission)
  - "Thank you to everyone who joined us for [event name]..."
- **Story highlights:** Save event stories to a permanent "Events" highlight on Instagram

## Within 1 Week
- **Follow-up offer:** Personal message to engaged attendees
  - "Roberto noticed you loved the Brunello — we have a limited allocation available. Shall I set aside a case for you?"
- **Attendee survey:** Quick 3-question survey (optional)
  - Favorite wine of the night?
  - Would you attend another event?
  - Any friends who'd love this?

## Conversion Goals
- **Immediate:** Wine sales from tasted portfolio (target: 30% of attendees purchase within 1 week)
- **Medium-term:** Sign up for 7 Cellars VIP/wine club list (target: 50% of attendees)
- **Long-term:** Repeat attendance and referrals (target: 40% attend another event within 3 months)

## Content Bank
- All event photos stored in organized folders (by date and event name)
- Best photos flagged for future marketing use
- Guest testimonials captured and filed (with permission)
- Video clips (if any) for Instagram Reels and future promotion

---

# Budget Template

## Per-Event Cost Breakdown (15-Person Intimate Tasting)

| Line Item | Estimated Cost | Notes |
|---|---|---|
| Wine (5 bottles × $15–$30 wholesale) | $75–$150 | At wholesale cost |
| Food (cheeses, charcuterie, accompaniments) | $150–$250 | ~$10–$17 per person |
| Glassware rental (if needed) | $50–$100 | Or use 7 Cellars inventory |
| Venue fee | $0–$500 | Free if restaurant partner or 7 Cellars space |
| Printed materials (tasting cards, menus) | $25–$50 | |
| Staff (1–2 assistants, 3 hours) | $100–$200 | |
| Photography | $0–$300 | In-house vs. hired |
| Miscellaneous (ice, linens, transport) | $50–$100 | |
| **Total Cost** | **$450–$1,650** | |

## Revenue (15-Person Intimate Tasting)

| Revenue Source | Amount |
|---|---|
| Ticket sales (15 × $95) | $1,425 |
| Post-event wine sales (estimate: 5 guests buy 1 case avg.) | $750–$1,500+ |
| **Total Revenue** | **$2,175–$2,925+** |
| **Net Margin on Event Alone** | **$525–$1,475** |

## Revenue (Corporate Event — 30 Guests)

| Revenue Source | Amount |
|---|---|
| Flat fee (Silver package) | $4,500 |
| Estimated cost | $1,500–$2,500 |
| **Net margin** | **$2,000–$3,000** |

> **Key insight:** Even at break-even, events are profitable when you factor in post-event wine sales and customer lifetime value. A single UHNW client acquired through a tasting can represent $5,000–$20,000+ in annual purchases.

---

# Seasonal Calendar

## January – March (Peak Tourist Season)
- **Champagne & Caviar New Year Event** (early January)
- **Valentine's Day Couples Tasting** — romantic, intimate, premium wines + chocolate pairing
- **Italian Wine Week** — multi-day themed tastings at partner restaurants
- **Corporate season:** Board meetings and offsites in Cayman — target corporate private bookings

## April – June (Shoulder Season)
- **Spring Rosé Launch** — lighter wines, outdoor venue, sunset timing
- **Earth Day / Sustainability Tasting** — feature organic and biodynamic wines
- **Restaurant Staff Training Blitz** — off-season is ideal for partner training sessions
- **Private villa bookings** — residents entertaining spring visitors

## July – September (Summer / Slower Season)
- **Bastille Day French Wine Dinner** (July 14) — all-French flight at French restaurant partner
- **Cayman Cookout tie-in** (if timing aligns) — piggyback on food festival traffic
- **Summer Wine School Series** — 4-week educational course (intermediate level)
- **Yacht charter partnerships** — peak charter season, push private yacht tastings

## October – December (Build to Peak Season)
- **Harvest Season Celebration** (October) — celebrate the Northern Hemisphere vintage
- **Thanksgiving Wine Pairing Workshop** (November) — help customers choose wines for their table
- **Holiday Corporate Gifts + Events** (November–December) — biggest corporate booking window
- **New Year's Eve Champagne Preview** (December) — sell Champagne cases while tasting
- **Pirates Week tie-in** (November) — fun themed tasting event

## Year-Round Opportunities
- **Monthly "First Friday" tastings** — recurring event that builds community and habit
- **New vintage arrivals** — every time a new wine lands, host a launch tasting
- **Pop-up tastings at partner restaurants** — low-cost, high-visibility, drives restaurant wine sales
- **Private bookings** — always available on request for UHNW clients

files.name: Weekly Report Template
files.content:
# 7 Cellars — Weekly Sales Report

**Submitted by:** Roberto Logioia, Director of Sales  
**Week of:** February 3–7, 2025  
**Date Submitted:** Friday, February 7, 2025

---

## 1. Week Summary

- Closed first order with The Ritz-Carlton — 3 cases Whispering Angel, 2 cases Miraval
- Delivered restock to Lobster Pot and Agua (both reordered within 2 weeks)
- Met with F&B Director at Kimpton Seafire — strong interest in by-the-glass program
- Ran tasting event at Camana Bay Wine Bar — 22 attendees, solid engagement
- Jacques Scott running 15% off promotion on rosé — monitoring impact

---

## 2. Sales This Week

| Metric | This Week | Last Week |
|--------|-----------|-----------|
| **Total Revenue** | $4,850 | $3,200 |
| **Number of Orders** | 7 | 5 |
| **New Accounts** | 1 | 0 |

**Top Accounts This Week:**
- Lobster Pot — $1,200 (restock, 4 cases mixed)
- The Ritz-Carlton — $1,800 (new account, first order)
- Agua Restaurant — $680 (restock, 2 cases)

**Notable Orders:**
- Ritz-Carlton wants to trial 5 wines for their pool bar menu — follow-up tasting scheduled next Tuesday

---

## 3. New Leads / Prospects

| Lead | Contact | Where We Met | Follow-Up |
|------|---------|-------------|-----------|
| Kimpton Seafire | James Wright, F&B Director | Cold visit | Send wine list + schedule tasting (next week) |
| Blue Cilantro | Maria Santos, Owner | Camana Bay event | She asked for pricing on Italian reds — send by Monday |
| Grand Old House | David Chen, Sommelier | Referral from Roberto's network | Call to introduce — interested in Burgundy |

---

## 4. Active Account Updates

- **Lobster Pot** — Reordered faster than expected. Their Whispering Angel is moving well. Manager asked about adding a Sancerre option.
- **Agua Restaurant** — Happy with current selection. Want to discuss an exclusive wine dinner in March.
- **Sunshine Suites** — Slow movement on retail bottles. May need to swap out the Pinot Grigio for something with more brand recognition.
- **The Brasserie** — No order this week. Chef mentioned they're reviewing all suppliers next month — need to stay close.

---

## 5. Inventory Alerts

| Item | Status | Action Needed |
|------|--------|---------------|
| Whispering Angel Rosé | **Low** — 8 bottles remaining | Reorder urgently, moving fast across 3 accounts |
| Miraval Rosé | OK — 2 cases | Monitor, may need reorder in 2 weeks |
| Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc | **Out of Stock** | On order, ETA February 14 |
| Damaged — 2 bottles Barolo | Write off | Shipping damage, documented with photos |

---

## 6. Competitor Intel

- **Jacques Scott** — Running 15% off all rosé through February. Noticed shelf signage at their George Town location. Could pressure our rosé pricing.
- **Tasting Room** — Opened a new pop-up tasting space at Camana Bay on weekends. Drawing foot traffic. Worth monitoring.
- **General** — Several restaurants mentioned they're being approached by a new distributor from Miami. No name yet — will dig deeper.

---

## 7. Tastings & Events

**This Week:**
- **Camana Bay Wine Bar Tasting** (Wednesday, Feb 5) — 22 attendees, poured 6 wines. Best received: the Chablis and the Barolo. Collected 8 email sign-ups. Two attendees asked about wholesale.

**Upcoming:**
- **Ritz-Carlton Pool Bar Tasting** — Tuesday, Feb 11 (confirmed with F&B team)
- **7 Cellars Valentine's Day Promo** — Planning a "Date Night" wine bundle for retail. Need to finalize pricing by Monday.

---

## 8. Challenges / Blockers

- **Shipping delays** — Cloudy Bay shipment stuck in Miami. Need to follow up with freight forwarder daily.
- **Vehicle** — Delivery van AC is broken again. Hard to keep wine at proper temperature in midday heat. Need repair ASAP or temporary rental.
- **Pricing pressure** — Jacques Scott discount on rosé making some accounts ask for lower prices. Need guidance from partners on how aggressive we want to be.

---

## 9. Next Week Priorities

1. Close Kimpton Seafire tasting appointment — high-value account
2. Follow up with Blue Cilantro on Italian reds pricing
3. Run Ritz-Carlton pool bar tasting (Tuesday)
4. Finalize Valentine's Day bundle pricing and promote to retail accounts
5. Chase Cloudy Bay shipment — need ETA confirmation

---

## 10. Market Intel / Ideas

- Multiple restaurant managers mentioned customers asking for **natural wines** — could be worth adding 2-3 to our portfolio
- Valentine's week is huge for wine sales here — every restaurant does a special dinner. We should have a "Valentine's package" ready for next year, planned by December
- Heard from Agua's manager that **brunch wine service** is growing — mimosa kits and sparkling by the glass are trending. We should think about a sparkling wine push for Q2
- George Town cruise ship traffic has been heavy — the wine shops near the port are doing well. Worth exploring a retail partnership there

---

*This report should be submitted every Friday by 5:00 PM to: dwayne@7cellars.ky*

*Keep it honest, keep it brief. If a section has nothing to report, write "Nothing to report" — don't skip it.*

# 7 Cellars — WhatsApp Message Templates

Ready-to-use templates for the team. Copy into **WhatsApp Business Quick Replies** or save in phone Notes.

---

## How to Set Up Quick Replies (WhatsApp Business)

1. Open WhatsApp Business → **Settings** → **Business Tools** → **Quick Replies**
2. Tap **+** to add new
3. Paste the template message
4. Set the **shortcut** (e.g. `/orderconfirm`)
5. To use: type the shortcut in any chat → tap to insert → edit the [brackets]

---

## 📦 ORDER & DELIVERY

### 1. Order Confirmation
**Shortcut:** `/orderconfirm`

```
Hi [Name]! 👋

Thank you for your order with 7 Cellars. Here's your summary:

🍷 Order: [items]
💰 Total: $[amount] KYD
📅 Estimated delivery: [date/timeframe]

We'll message you when your delivery is on its way. If you have any questions, just reply here!

Cheers,
7 Cellars
```

---

### 2. Delivery Scheduling
**Shortcut:** `/schedule`

```
Hi [Name],

We're ready to deliver your order! 🚗

When works best for you?
📅 Date: ___
⏰ Time window: ___
📍 Delivery address: [address on file]

Just reply with your preferred time and we'll get it scheduled.

7 Cellars
```

---

### 3. On the Way
**Shortcut:** `/otw`

```
Hi [Name]! Your 7 Cellars delivery is on its way 🚗🍷

📍 Delivering to: [address]
⏰ ETA: [time]
👤 Driver: [name]

Someone 18+ will need to be available to receive the delivery. See you soon!
```

---

### 4. Delivery Complete
**Shortcut:** `/delivered`

```
Hi [Name], your delivery has been completed! ✅🍷

We hope you enjoy your selections. A few tips:
🌡️ Store wine at 12-18°C, away from direct sunlight
🍾 Sparkling wines are best chilled to 6-8°C before serving

Questions about food pairings or serving suggestions? Just ask — Roberto is happy to help!

Cheers,
7 Cellars
```

---

### 5. Delivery Rescheduled
**Shortcut:** `/resched`

```
Hi [Name],

Just a heads up — we need to reschedule your delivery originally planned for [original date].

New delivery: [new date/time]

Apologies for any inconvenience. Reply here if the new time doesn't work and we'll sort it out.

7 Cellars
```

---

## 💳 PAYMENTS

### 6. Payment Reminder (Friendly)
**Shortcut:** `/payremind`

```
Hi [Name], hope you're well! 😊

Quick reminder that invoice #[number] for $[amount] KYD is due [date]. 

Payment options:
🏦 Bank transfer: [details]
💳 Other: [details]

If already sent, please disregard! Let us know if you have any questions.

7 Cellars
```

---

### 7. Payment Received
**Shortcut:** `/paid`

```
Hi [Name],

Payment of $[amount] KYD received — thank you! ✅

Your account is all up to date. We appreciate your business!

7 Cellars
```

---

## 🤝 CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIPS

### 8. New Customer Welcome
**Shortcut:** `/welcome`

```
Welcome to 7 Cellars! 🍷✨

We're Grand Cayman's curated wine and spirits partner. Here's what you can expect:

🚗 White-glove delivery across the island
🍷 Hand-selected wines from France & Italy
🥃 Premium spirits & craft cocktail essentials
👨‍🍳 Food pairings & sommelier recommendations

Our sommelier Roberto is always available to help with selections. Just message us anytime!

www.7cellars.ky
```

---

### 9. Follow-Up After First Order
**Shortcut:** `/followup`

```
Hi [Name]! 👋

How are you enjoying your recent order? We'd love to hear your thoughts!

If you'd like recommendations for your next selection, just let us know:
🍷 What you enjoyed most
🍽️ Any upcoming dinners or events
💰 Your preferred price range

Roberto can put together a personalized selection just for you.

7 Cellars
```

---

### 10. Re-Order Prompt
**Shortcut:** `/reorder`

```
Hi [Name]! 

It's been a little while since your last order. Running low on anything? 😊

Some highlights this month:
🍷 [featured wine 1]
🍷 [featured wine 2]
🥃 [featured spirit]

Want us to put together your usual, or try something new? Just reply here!

7 Cellars
```

---

## 🏢 WHOLESALE / RESTAURANT

### 11. New Restaurant Welcome
**Shortcut:** `/restwelcome`

```
Hi [Name],

Welcome to 7 Cellars! We're excited to partner with [Restaurant Name]. 🍷

Here's what we offer our restaurant partners:
📋 Curated wine lists tailored to your menu
🚗 Regular delivery schedule
💰 Competitive wholesale pricing
🎓 Staff wine training with our sommelier Roberto
📊 Monthly sales reporting

I'd love to schedule a tasting to walk through our portfolio. When works for you?

Roberto Logioia
Sommelier, Director of Sales
7 Cellars | (345) 526-8466
```

---

### 12. Wholesale Price List Share
**Shortcut:** `/pricelist`

```
Hi [Name],

Here's our current wholesale price list as discussed. [attach PDF]

A few highlights:
🍷 [featured category/wine]
🥃 [featured spirit]
✨ [any current promotions]

Minimum order: [amount]
Delivery: Free across Grand Cayman

Let me know if you'd like to schedule a tasting or have any questions!

Roberto | 7 Cellars
```

---

### 13. Restaurant Restock Check-In
**Shortcut:** `/restock`

```
Hi [Name]! 

Time for your regular check-in 📋

Running low on anything? Here's what you last ordered:
🍷 [previous order items]

I can also suggest some new arrivals that would pair well with your menu. Just let me know!

Roberto | 7 Cellars
```

---

## 🛥️ YACHT & VILLA

### 14. Yacht/Villa Provisioning
**Shortcut:** `/yacht`

```
Hi [Name],

Thank you for reaching out about provisioning! 🛥️🍷

To put together the perfect selection, I'd love to know:

👥 Number of guests: ___
📅 Dates: ___
🍽️ Any dietary preferences or favorites?
💰 Budget range: ___
🚢 Vessel/villa name & location: ___

We handle everything — selection, delivery, and setup. Our sommelier Roberto will personally curate your experience.

7 Cellars | www.7cellars.ky
```

---

### 15. Villa Welcome Package Confirmation
**Shortcut:** `/villaconf`

```
Hi [Name],

Your welcome package is confirmed! 🎉

🏡 Property: [villa name]
📅 Delivery: [date] at [time]
📦 Package includes:
   [item list]

💰 Total: $[amount] KYD

We'll coordinate with the property manager for delivery. Enjoy your stay in Grand Cayman!

7 Cellars
```

---

## 🎉 EVENTS & WINE CLUB

### 16. Tasting Event Invite
**Shortcut:** `/tasting`

```
You're invited! 🍷✨

7 Cellars [Tasting Event Name]

📅 [Date]
⏰ [Time]
📍 [Location]
💰 [Price/complimentary]

Join our sommelier Roberto for an evening exploring [theme — e.g., "Italian reds from Tuscany & Piedmont"].

[Number] spots available — reply to reserve yours!

www.7cellars.ky
```

---

### 17. Wine Club Welcome
**Shortcut:** `/clubwelcome`

```
Welcome to The Cellar — 7 Cellars Wine Club! 🍷🎉

You've joined the [tier name] tier. Here's what to expect:

📦 Your first selection ships [date]
🍷 [number] bottles curated by our sommelier
📝 Tasting notes & food pairing cards included
🎟️ Exclusive member pricing & event invites

Questions? Just message us anytime.

Cheers to great wine!
7 Cellars
```

---

### 18. Wine Club Monthly Selection
**Shortcut:** `/clubmonth`

```
Hi [Name]! 🍷

Your [Month] wine club selection is ready:

🍷 [Wine 1] — [brief note]
🍷 [Wine 2] — [brief note]
🍷 [Wine 3] — [brief note]

📦 Delivery: [date]
📝 Tasting notes attached

Enjoy this month's picks! Reply if you'd like to add anything to your delivery.

The Cellar | 7 Cellars Wine Club
```

---

## ⚠️ SERVICE

### 19. Out of Stock / Alternative
**Shortcut:** `/oos`

```
Hi [Name],

Unfortunately [product] is currently out of stock. We're expecting the next shipment around [date].

In the meantime, Roberto recommends these alternatives:
🍷 [Alternative 1] — $[price] KYD — [why it's similar]
🍷 [Alternative 2] — $[price] KYD — [why it's similar]

Would you like to try one of these, or wait for the restock? We can also put you on the notification list.

7 Cellars
```

---

### 20. Thank You / Holiday
**Shortcut:** `/thanks`

```
Hi [Name],

Just wanted to say thank you for being a valued 7 Cellars customer! 🙏🍷

We truly appreciate your support and hope we continue to bring great wine and spirits to your table.

Wishing you [a wonderful holiday season / a great weekend / all the best]!

Cheers,
The 7 Cellars Team
```

---

## Quick Reference

| # | Template | Shortcut | Used By |
|---|----------|----------|---------|
| 1 | Order Confirmation | `/orderconfirm` | Tallyn |
| 2 | Delivery Scheduling | `/schedule` | Tallyn/Roberto |
