files.name: White Glove Delivery Sop
files.content:
# White Glove Delivery Standard Operating Procedure

## 7 Cellars — Grand Cayman

**Version:** 1.0
**Date:** February 10, 2026
**Prepared for:** 7 Cellars Partners

---

## TL;DR

Every delivery is a brand experience, not just a transaction. 7 Cellars' white glove delivery service is how we differentiate from every competitor on the island. Temperature-controlled, branded, personal, and memorable — when someone receives a 7 Cellars delivery, it should feel like receiving a gift, even if they ordered it themselves.

---

## Table of Contents

1. [Core Philosophy](#1-core-philosophy)
2. [Vehicle & Equipment Standards](#2-vehicle--equipment-standards)
3. [Packaging & Presentation](#3-packaging--presentation)
4. [Delivery Process — Residential (B2C)](#4-delivery-process--residential-b2c)
5. [Delivery Process — Restaurant & Hotel (B2B)](#5-delivery-process--restaurant--hotel-b2b)
6. [Yacht & Villa Provisioning](#6-yacht--villa-provisioning)
7. [Gift Orders](#7-gift-orders)
8. [Temperature Guarantee](#8-temperature-guarantee)
9. [Delivery Tiers & Timing](#9-delivery-tiers--timing)
10. [Cross-Selling & Retention](#10-cross-selling--retention)
11. [Staff Training for Restaurant Accounts](#11-staff-training-for-restaurant-accounts)
12. [What Our Competitors Don't Do](#12-what-our-competitors-dont-do)
13. [Metrics & Quality Control](#13-metrics--quality-control)
14. [Checklist — Every Delivery](#14-checklist--every-delivery)

---

## 1. Core Philosophy

7 Cellars is not a delivery service. We are a **premium wine and spirits experience** that happens to deliver.

Three principles guide every interaction:

- **Personal** — Every customer is known, not just an order number
- **Premium** — Every touchpoint reflects the quality of our products
- **Proactive** — We anticipate needs before customers ask

This is what "white glove" means at 7 Cellars. Jacques Scott delivers boxes. We deliver experiences.

---

## 2. Vehicle & Equipment Standards

### The Delivery Vehicle

| Requirement | Standard |
|---|---|
| **Branding** | Full 7 Cellars wrap or magnetic signage — clean, professional, on-brand |
| **Climate control** | Cargo area temperature-controlled or insulated cooler system — wine must stay below 22°C (72°F) |
| **Cleanliness** | Washed weekly minimum. Interior organized. No personal items visible |
| **Maintenance** | Regular service schedule. No breakdowns, no excuses |

### Equipment Checklist (Stocked Daily)

- Insulated delivery bags/totes (branded)
- Branded tissue paper and gift bags
- Tasting note cards (current inventory)
- "Welcome to 7 Cellars" cards (for first-time customers)
- Business cards
- Corkscrew (branded, for emergencies)
- Cleaning cloth
- Temperature data logger (for temperature guarantee claims)
- Mobile device for delivery confirmation photos

---

## 3. Packaging & Presentation

### Standard Delivery

Every order, regardless of size, arrives in branded packaging:

| Item | Packaging |
|---|---|
| **1-2 bottles** | 7 Cellars branded bag with tissue paper, sealed with branded sticker |
| **3-6 bottles** | 7 Cellars branded box with dividers, tissue wrap |
| **6+ bottles / cases** | Clean branded case with 7 Cellars tape/sticker seal |
| **Food products** | Branded tote or gift box, separated from wine |

### Included with Every Delivery

- **Tasting card** for each wine — grape, region, tasting notes, food pairing suggestion (written by Roberto, printed in-house)
- **Business card** — always
- **"Thank you for choosing 7 Cellars"** card on first order

### What Never Happens

- ❌ Plain cardboard box with no branding
- ❌ Bottles loose in a bag
- ❌ Product left at a doorstep in the sun
- ❌ Delivery person in shorts and flip-flops

---

## 4. Delivery Process — Residential (B2C)

### Before Delivery

1. **Order confirmed** via text/WhatsApp with estimated delivery window (1-2 hour range)
2. **15-minute heads-up** — text sent when driver is en route: *"Your 7 Cellars delivery is on its way — arriving in approximately 15 minutes."*

### During Delivery

3. **Arrive on time** within the quoted window
4. **Delivery person appearance** — branded polo or shirt, clean, professional, friendly
5. **Hand-deliver** to the customer personally — never leave at a door or with building security unless instructed
6. **Brief product introduction** — *"You've got the Caparzo Brunello tonight — beautiful with a grilled steak or aged cheese. Enjoy!"*
7. **Photo confirmation** — with customer's permission, snap a quick photo of the delivered package

### After Delivery

8. **Delivery confirmation text** — *"Your order has been delivered. Thank you for choosing 7 Cellars! Questions about your wines? Just reply here."*
9. **First-order follow-up** (next day) — *"How did you enjoy the [wine name]? We'd love to help you find your next favourite."*

---

## 5. Delivery Process — Restaurant & Hotel (B2B)

### Onboarding a New Account

1. **Roberto visits in person** for initial tasting and menu consultation (free)
2. Agree on a **regular delivery schedule** — same day, same time, every week
3. Establish **par levels** for their key products
4. Provide **branded table talkers/tent cards** — *"Wines curated by 7 Cellars"*
5. Offer a **staff training session** (30-60 min, see Section 11)

### Ongoing Deliveries

| Step | Action |
|---|---|
| **Scheduling** | Consistent weekly delivery — same day, same window. Reliability builds trust |
| **Arrival** | Check in with manager or sommelier. Never dump product at the back door |
| **Placement** | Product placed directly in their wine storage/cellar — organized by type |
| **Inventory check** | Visually check their stock levels. Flag anything running low |
| **Proactive reorder** | Text/email before they run out: *"Noticed you're down to 2 bottles of the Gimonnet. Want us to add a case to Thursday's delivery?"* |
| **Menu updates** | When new products arrive, bring a sample bottle for the chef/sommelier to taste |

### B2B Extras

- **Quarterly menu pairing review** — Roberto reviews their menu and updates wine pairing recommendations
- **Event support** — for private events, provide staff to pour and present wines
- **Branded collateral** — wine list inserts, table cards, event menus featuring 7 Cellars selections

---

## 6. Yacht & Villa Provisioning

This is a high-value channel unique to Grand Cayman. Superyacht chefs and villa property managers need premium provisions fast.

### Service Standard

| Element | Standard |
|---|---|
| **Ordering** | WhatsApp/phone — fast response, personal service |
| **Turnaround** | Same-day delivery for orders placed by 12:00 PM |
| **Packaging** | Premium branded cooler/hamper — ready to present to guests |
| **Setup** | Product delivered to the vessel/villa and organized in their storage |
| **Pairing menu** | Printed menu card with food pairing suggestions for the chef |
| **Restocking** | Proactive check-in mid-charter: *"Need anything topped up?"* |

### How to Build This Channel

- Partner with yacht management companies and charter brokers
- Connect with villa property managers (especially Seven Mile Beach, Rum Point)
- Offer a **provisioning catalog** — curated wine + food packages at fixed prices
- Premium pricing — convenience and exclusivity command 20-30% above standard retail

---

## 7. Gift Orders

Gift deliveries are the highest-stakes interaction — someone is sending a product to impress.

### Gift Packaging

| Package | Contents | Presentation |
|---|---|---|
| **Single bottle gift** | Wine + tasting card + personal message card | Gift bag, tissue paper, branded ribbon, sealed |
| **Wine + food gift box** | Wine + cheese/charcuterie/truffle products | Branded hamper box, arranged beautifully, personal message card |
| **Premium gift box** | Multi-bottle + food + accessories | Custom branded wooden or presentation box |

### Gift Delivery Process

1. **Confirm recipient availability** — call/text ahead to ensure someone is home
2. **Deliver personally** — never leave a gift at a door
3. **Photo of delivered gift** — sent to the sender as confirmation
4. **Follow-up to sender** — *"Your gift was delivered to [name] at [time]. They loved it!"*

---

## 8. Temperature Guarantee

**The 7 Cellars Temperature Promise:**

*"Every bottle arrives at the right temperature. If your wine arrives warm, we replace it — no questions asked."*

### How We Deliver on This

- Climate-controlled or insulated cargo area on every delivery
- Insulated delivery bags for every order
- No product left in a vehicle or at a doorstep
- Temperature data logger in vehicle (random audits)
- Deliveries scheduled to avoid peak heat (prefer morning or late afternoon runs)

### Cayman-Specific Considerations

- Ambient temperature regularly exceeds 30°C (86°F)
- Wine degrades above 25°C — even 30 minutes in a hot vehicle damages quality
- This guarantee is something **no competitor on the island offers**
- This single promise justifies premium pricing

---

## 9. Delivery Tiers & Timing

| Tier | Turnaround | Fee | Threshold for Free |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Standard delivery** | Next business day, 1-2 hour window | CI$10 | Free over CI$150 |
| **Same-day delivery** | Order by 12:00 PM, delivered by 6:00 PM | CI$15 | Free over CI$300 |
| **Rush delivery** | Within 2 hours of order | CI$25 | Free over CI$500 |
| **Scheduled recurring** | Set day/time weekly or bi-weekly | Free | All recurring orders |

### Delivery Hours

- **Monday – Saturday:** 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM
- **Sunday:** By appointment only (events, yacht provisioning)
- **Holidays:** Limited service — communicate in advance

---

## 10. Cross-Selling & Retention

Every delivery is a sales opportunity — done subtly, not pushy.

### At Delivery

- **Recommendation card** included: *"Based on your order of [wine], you might also enjoy [complementary wine or food product]..."*
- **New arrival card** when applicable: *"Just in — [new product]. Ask us about it."*

### After Delivery

- **Monthly email/WhatsApp** to active customers with new arrivals and pairing suggestions
- **Standing order program — "The 7 Cellars Club"** — monthly curated selection delivered automatically
  - Tier 1: 2 bottles/month (CI$75-100)
  - Tier 2: 4 bottles/month (CI$150-200)
  - Tier 3: 6 bottles + food pairing (CI$250-350)
- **Loyalty program** — after 10 orders, complimentary bottle or tasting event invitation
- **Birthday/Anniversary** — if we know the date, send a personalized note or small gift

### Seasonal Opportunities

- **Christmas/New Year** — curated gift boxes, corporate gifting program
- **Pirates Week** — themed selections
- **Easter** — Italian wine + food hampers (timed with container arrivals)
- **Cayman Cookout** — special event pairings

---

## 11. Staff Training for Restaurant Accounts

When onboarding a new restaurant account, Roberto (or a trained 7 Cellars representative) conducts a **complimentary staff training session**.

### Session Format

| Element | Details |
|---|---|
| **Duration** | 30-60 minutes |
| **Who attends** | Front-of-house staff, bartenders, sommelier (if applicable) |
| **Format** | Guided tasting of 4-6 wines from their order |
| **Content** | Region, grape, flavor profile, food pairing, how to describe to guests |
| **Leave-behind** | Printed tasting cards for each wine, pairing cheat sheet |

### Why This Matters

- Staff who taste the wine **sell more wine** — they speak from experience, not a menu
- Creates loyalty — the restaurant team becomes 7 Cellars advocates
- Differentiator — Jacques Scott does not do this
- Repeat training when new products are added to their wine list

---

## 12. What Our Competitors Don't Do

| Service Element | 7 Cellars | Jacques Scott | Blackbeard's | Others |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Branded delivery vehicle | ✅ | ❌ Basic delivery | ❌ | ❌ |
| Climate-controlled delivery | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Temperature guarantee | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Tasting cards with every bottle | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Branded packaging | ✅ | ❌ Basic bags | ❌ | ❌ |
| 15-minute arrival notification | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Photo delivery confirmation | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Restaurant staff training | ✅ | ❌ | N/A | ❌ |
| Proactive reorder management | ✅ | ❌ | N/A | ❌ |
| Yacht & villa provisioning | ✅ | Limited | ❌ | ❌ |
| Same-day / rush delivery | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |
| Handwritten first-order note | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ | ❌ |

---

## 13. Metrics & Quality Control

### Track Weekly

| Metric | Target |
|---|---|
| **On-time delivery rate** | > 95% within quoted window |
| **Temperature complaints** | Zero |
| **Customer satisfaction** | Follow up on 100% of first orders |
| **Delivery photo completion** | 100% of residential orders |
| **Proactive reorder texts (B2B)** | Weekly for all active accounts |

### Monthly Review

- Number of deliveries by tier (standard, same-day, rush)
- New accounts onboarded
- Repeat order rate
- Gift order volume
- Yacht/villa provisioning revenue
- Customer feedback themes

---

## 14. Checklist — Every Delivery

### Before Leaving the Warehouse

- [ ] Vehicle clean and climate system running
- [ ] All orders packed in branded packaging
- [ ] Tasting cards included for each wine
- [ ] Business cards stocked
- [ ] Thank-you cards for first-time customers
- [ ] Insulated bags loaded
- [ ] Delivery route planned, windows confirmed
- [ ] Customer notifications sent (15 min before)

### At the Customer

- [ ] Arrive within quoted window
- [ ] Professional appearance (branded shirt, clean)
- [ ] Hand-deliver to customer personally
- [ ] Brief product introduction
- [ ] Photo confirmation (with permission)
- [ ] Collect any feedback or future order requests

### After Delivery

- [ ] Send delivery confirmation text
- [ ] Log delivery in system (time, photo, notes)
- [ ] Flag any issues for follow-up
- [ ] First-order follow-up queued for next day

---

*This SOP is a living document. Review quarterly and update based on customer feedback, seasonal changes, and business growth.*

*7 Cellars — Grand Cayman*
*"Every bottle, an experience."*

files.name: Wine Club Program
files.content:
# Concept & Positioning

## Why a Wine Club on Grand Cayman?

Grand Cayman is home to approximately 80,000 residents — a concentrated community of ultra-high-net-worth individuals, expat professionals, and discerning wine enthusiasts. Despite this affluent, cosmopolitan population, **no wine distributor on the island currently offers a curated subscription service.**

The 7 Cellars Club fills this gap with a sommelier-curated, white-glove wine experience delivered directly to members' doors — temperature-guaranteed and personally selected by Roberto Logioia.

## What Makes It Special

- **Sommelier-Curated:** Every bottle hand-selected by Roberto Logioia, bringing decades of expertise and direct relationships with producers worldwide
- **Island Exclusive:** The first and only wine subscription service on Grand Cayman — a true market differentiator against competitors like Jacques Scott
- **White Glove Delivery:** Temperature-controlled logistics from warehouse to doorstep, critical in the Caribbean climate
- **Beyond Wine:** Higher tiers incorporate curated specialty foods — artisan cheeses, charcuterie, and pairings — leveraging 7 Cellars' expansion into specialty foods
- **Community:** Not just bottles — a membership that includes events, tastings, priority access, and a direct line to your personal sommelier

## The Opportunity

| Factor | Detail |
|--------|--------|
| Market Size | ~80,000 residents, heavily skewed affluent |
| Competition | Zero subscription/club offerings from any competitor |
| Average Household Income | Among highest in the Caribbean |
| Expat Community | Large, well-connected, accustomed to subscription services |
| Seasonal Residents | Part-time residents benefit from curated deliveries during visits |

---

# Membership Tiers

## Discovery — The Perfect Introduction

**2 bottles per month | CI$75–100/month**

Ideal for wine-curious residents and those looking to expand their palate without commitment to large volumes.

**What's Included:**
- 2 expertly selected bottles — a mix of varietals, regions, and styles
- Roberto's tasting notes card with each delivery
- QR code linking to tasting video or audio notes
- Access to member pricing on all additional purchases

**Who It's For:** Newcomers to wine, busy professionals who want great wine without the research, gift subscribers.

---

## Connoisseur — For the Devoted Wine Lover

**4 bottles per month | CI$150–200/month**

A step up in both quality and depth. Connoisseur members receive premium selections alongside food pairing guidance to elevate every bottle.

**What's Included:**
- 4 premium bottles — including at least one limited-allocation wine
- Roberto's detailed tasting notes with region and producer profiles
- Food pairing card — specific dishes, recipes, or ingredient suggestions for each wine
- Priority notification on new arrivals and limited releases
- 10% discount on all additional purchases

**Who It's For:** Experienced wine drinkers, home entertainers, couples who enjoy wine with dinner.

---

## Grand Cru — The Ultimate Wine Experience

**6 bottles + curated food pairing | CI$250–350/month**

The flagship tier. Grand Cru members receive the finest wines in our portfolio alongside a curated specialty food pairing — think artisan cheese, charcuterie, crackers, and accompaniments selected to complement that month's wines.

**What's Included:**
- 6 exceptional bottles — including rare, small-production, and allocated wines
- Curated food pairing box — artisan cheese, charcuterie, crackers, olives, or seasonal accompaniments
- Roberto's comprehensive tasting guide with vertical and horizontal tasting suggestions
- First access to all limited releases — before they hit the general catalog
- Invitation to exclusive Grand Cru-only tastings and dinners (quarterly)
- Complimentary birthday bottle (value up to CI$75)
- 10% discount on all additional purchases

**Who It's For:** Serious collectors, entertainers, wine enthusiasts who want a complete experience.

---

## Corporate — For Offices, Firms & Hospitality Partners

**Custom selection | Pricing by arrangement**

Designed for law firms, financial services offices, real estate agencies, and hospitality businesses that want to keep a curated wine selection on hand for clients, events, and team celebrations.

**What's Included:**
- Custom bottle count and frequency (monthly or bi-monthly)
- Mix of wines suited to client entertaining and office occasions
- Branded tasting notes available for client-facing use
- Volume pricing and flexible billing
- Event support — Roberto available for private corporate tastings
- Dedicated account management

**Who It's For:** Law firms on the Mile, financial services, property developers, boutique hotels, restaurants exploring rotating by-the-glass programs.

---

# What's Included in Every Membership

| Feature | Discovery | Connoisseur | Grand Cru | Corporate |
|---------|-----------|-------------|-----------|-----------|
| Sommelier-Selected Wines | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Roberto's Tasting Notes | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Food Pairing Card | — | ✓ | ✓ | Optional |
| Curated Food Pairing Box | — | — | ✓ | Optional |
| Priority New Arrivals Access | — | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| Member Discount (10%) | — | ✓ | ✓ | Volume |
| Quarterly Tasting Events | Paid | Free | Free + Exclusive | Custom |
| Birthday Bottle | — | — | ✓ (up to CI$75) | — |
| White Glove Delivery | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |

---

# Member Benefits

## Priority Access to Limited Wines

Members get first pick on allocated, small-production, and rare wines before they're offered to the general customer base. Grand Cru members have absolute first priority.

## Quarterly Tasting Events

7 Cellars hosts quarterly wine tasting events — themed around regions, varietals, or seasonal pairings. Connoisseur and Grand Cru members attend free. Discovery members receive a discounted rate. Grand Cru members also receive invitations to intimate, exclusive dinners with visiting winemakers or producers.

## Birthday Bottle

Grand Cru members receive a complimentary bottle (value up to CI$75) during their birthday month — delivered with a personalized note from Roberto.

## 10% Off Additional Purchases

Connoisseur and Grand Cru members enjoy 10% off any additional wine or spirits purchased outside their monthly subscription — whether for a dinner party, gift, or personal collection.

## Referral Rewards

Members who refer a friend receive a bonus bottle added to their next delivery. The referred friend receives their first month at a 15% discount.

## Direct Line to Roberto

All members have access to Roberto via WhatsApp for personal wine recommendations, event suggestions, and pairing advice. Grand Cru members receive proactive recommendations based on their preferences and history.

---

# Logistics & Delivery

## Monthly Delivery Schedule

- **Delivery Window:** First week of each month (Monday–Friday)
- **Time Slots:** Morning (9am–12pm) or afternoon (1pm–5pm) — member's preference
- **Temperature Guarantee:** All deliveries in temperature-controlled packaging, critical for Grand Cayman's climate
- **Delivery Area:** Island-wide across Grand Cayman
- **Notification:** Members receive a WhatsApp or email notification 48 hours before delivery, with a 1-hour window alert on delivery day

## Flexibility Built In

- **Skip a Month:** Members can skip any month with 7 days' notice — no penalty, no questions
- **Pause:** Pause membership for up to 3 months (e.g., extended travel) and resume seamlessly
- **Cancel Anytime:** No long-term contracts. Cancel with 14 days' notice before the next billing cycle
- **Upgrade/Downgrade:** Switch tiers at any time, effective the following month

## Gift Subscriptions

- Available in 3-month, 6-month, and 12-month packages across all tiers
- Custom gift card and presentation packaging
- Recipient receives a welcome call from Roberto
- Popular for: birthdays, holidays, closing gifts (real estate), client appreciation

---

# Launch Plan

## Phase 1: Founding Members (Month 1–2)

**Goal:** Secure 20–30 founding members before public launch.

- **Founding Member Benefits:**
  - Pricing locked for the first 12 months (immune to any price adjustments)
  - "Founding Member" designation — permanent recognition
  - Exclusive founding member tasting event with Roberto
  - First access to the Grand Cru tier

- **Recruitment Channels:**
  - Personal outreach from Roberto and the 7 Cellars team to existing top customers
  - Private invitation via email and WhatsApp to known wine enthusiasts
  - Soft launch at a hosted tasting event (invite-only, 30–40 guests)

## Phase 2: Public Launch (Month 3)

- Website sign-up page goes live
- Instagram and email campaign begins
- Restaurant and hospitality partnership outreach
- PR: Feature in local publications (Cayman Compass, Loop Cayman)

## Phase 3: Growth (Month 4–12)

- Expand to 50+ members by month 6
- Introduce seasonal specials and limited-edition club boxes
- Corporate tier outreach to George Town firms
- Quarterly events become anchor marketing moments
- Review pricing and tier structure at 12-month mark

---

# Marketing Strategy

## Instagram & Social Media

- **Behind the scenes:** Roberto selecting wines, visiting producers, curating boxes
- **Unboxing content:** Beautiful delivery shots, member stories
- **Tasting notes:** Short video or carousel posts for each month's selections
- **Event recaps:** Photos and stories from quarterly tastings
- **Member spotlights:** (With permission) feature members enjoying their selections

## Email Marketing

- Monthly newsletter to subscriber list with wine highlights
- Targeted campaigns to existing 7 Cellars customers who haven't joined
- Automated welcome sequence for new members
- Re-engagement campaigns for lapsed members

## Restaurant & Hospitality Partnerships

- Partner with 3–5 high-end restaurants to cross-promote
- Offer restaurant staff complimentary Discovery tier as education tool
- Co-host events with partner restaurants featuring club wines
- Place sign-up cards and QR codes at partner locations

## Word of Mouth & Referrals

- The referral program (bonus bottle + 15% off for referred friend) is the primary growth engine
- Grand Cayman's tight-knit social circles make word of mouth exceptionally powerful
- Target: each member refers at least 1 new member within their first 6 months

## Partnerships & Sponsorships

- Real estate agencies: Gift subscriptions as closing gifts
- Private banks and wealth managers: Client appreciation gifts
- Yacht clubs and marinas: Seasonal partnerships
- Charity events: Sponsor and provide tasting experiences

---

# Revenue Projections

## Monthly Revenue by Scenario

| Tier | Price (Mid) | 50 Members | 100 Members | 200 Members |
|------|-------------|------------|-------------|-------------|
| Discovery (40%) | CI$87.50 | CI$1,750 | CI$3,500 | CI$7,000 |
| Connoisseur (35%) | CI$175 | CI$3,063 | CI$6,125 | CI$12,250 |
| Grand Cru (20%) | CI$300 | CI$3,000 | CI$6,000 | CI$12,000 |
| Corporate (5%) | CI$500 | CI$1,250 | CI$2,500 | CI$5,000 |
| **Monthly Total** | | **CI$9,063** | **CI$18,125** | **CI$36,250** |
| **Annual Total** | | **CI$108,750** | **CI$217,500** | **CI$435,000** |

> *Tier distribution assumptions: 40% Discovery, 35% Connoisseur, 20% Grand Cru, 5% Corporate. Actual mix will vary.*

## Additional Revenue Streams

- **Member add-on purchases** (10% discount still profitable): Estimated 30% of members make at least 1 additional purchase per month, average CI$80
- **Gift subscriptions:** Estimated 10–15% of total subscriptions are gifts, with higher margins on premium packaging
- **Events:** While quarterly events for members are free/discounted, they drive exposure and convert guests to members
- **Corporate upselling:** Corporate accounts have significant growth potential — recurring quarterly orders, event support

## Break-Even Analysis

| Cost Category | Monthly Estimate |
|---------------|-----------------|
| Wine COGS (avg 50% of retail) | ~50% of revenue |
| Specialty Food (Grand Cru) | ~CI$30–40/box |
| Packaging & Delivery | ~CI$10–15/delivery |
| Marketing & Events | ~CI$1,500–2,500 |
| CRM & Technology | ~CI$200–400 |
| Staff Time (Roberto + delivery) | Existing staff allocation |

**Estimated break-even: 35–45 members** (depending on tier mix and COGS).

---

# Operations

## Wine Selection Process

1. **Monthly Curation:** Roberto selects wines 4–6 weeks in advance, considering:
   - Seasonal appropriateness
   - Variety and balance across the year (no repeat producers within 6 months)
   - Value-to-quality ratio at each tier
   - Availability and inventory levels
2. **Tasting Notes:** Written by Roberto for each wine — origin, tasting profile, suggested pairings, serving temperature
3. **Food Pairing Curation:** For Connoisseur (card) and Grand Cru (physical pairing box), pairings are designed monthly to complement the wine selection

## Packing & Fulfillment

- **Packing Timeline:** Boxes assembled 2–3 days before delivery window
- **Temperature Control:** Climate-appropriate insulated packaging with cold packs during warmer months
- **Quality Check:** Each box inspected before sealing — correct wines, notes, condition
- **Labeling:** Personalized label with member name and tier

## Delivery

- **In-house delivery team** using 7 Cellars vehicles (temperature-controlled)
- **Route optimization:** Deliveries batched by area for efficiency
- **Delivery confirmation:** Photo confirmation via WhatsApp or app notification
- **Failed delivery protocol:** If member unavailable, secure with building management or reschedule within 48 hours

## CRM & Member Tracking

- **Member profiles:** Preferences, delivery history, feedback, tier, referral source
- **Automated billing:** Monthly charge on the 25th, delivery first week of following month
- **Communication log:** All interactions tracked (WhatsApp, email, phone)
- **Feedback loop:** Post-delivery survey (optional, short) to refine future selections
- **Churn tracking:** Monitor skip rates, downgrades, and cancellations — proactive outreach for at-risk members

---

# Sign-Up Flow

## Online (Website)

1. Visit **7cellars.ky/club** (or dedicated landing page)
2. Browse tiers and select membership level
3. Enter delivery details and preferences (red/white/mixed, adventurous vs. classic)
4. Payment via credit card (recurring monthly charge)
5. Welcome email with confirmation, delivery schedule, and Roberto's personal welcome
6. First delivery within 5 business days of sign-up

## WhatsApp

1. Message 7 Cellars on WhatsApp (published number)
2. Express interest in The 7 Cellars Club
3. Team sends tier information and sign-up link
4. Alternatively, sign up entirely via WhatsApp — team processes manually for VIP experience
5. Confirmation and welcome message from Roberto

## In-Person

1. Visit 7 Cellars warehouse or meet Roberto at an event
2. Browse selections, discuss preferences
3. Sign up on the spot — tablet or paper form
4. First box can be taken home immediately or scheduled for delivery

---

# Customer-Facing Summary

> **The 7 Cellars Club** — Grand Cayman's first and only sommelier-curated wine subscription.
>
> Every month, Roberto Logioia hand-selects exceptional wines and delivers them to your door — temperature-guaranteed, with tasting notes and food pairings included. Choose from three tiers to match your lifestyle, skip or pause anytime, and enjoy exclusive access to limited wines, quarterly tastings, and member-only events.
>
> No contracts. No commitments. Just extraordinary wine, delivered.
>
> **Join at 7cellars.ky/club or message us on WhatsApp.**

---

# Appendix: Founding Member Invitation (Draft)

> **You're Invited — Be a Founding Member of The 7 Cellars Club**
>
> We're launching Grand Cayman's first sommelier-curated wine subscription, and we'd like you to be among the first to join.
>
> As a Founding Member, you'll receive:
> - Your membership price locked for 12 months
> - Permanent "Founding Member" recognition
> - An exclusive tasting event with Roberto before public launch
> - First access to our Grand Cru tier
>
> Spaces are limited to 30 Founding Members. Reply to this message or contact Roberto directly to reserve your spot.
>
> **Roberto Logioia**
> Sommelier, 7 Cellars
> roberto@7cellars.ky | WhatsApp: (345) XXX-XXXX

files.content:
# Wine Intake Process — Standard Operating Procedure

## Flow:
1. **Tallyn fills Google Sheet** — producer, wine name, vintage, grape, qty, prices
2. **Tallyn adds photos** — bottle shots from supplier or her own photos
3. **Mika enriches:**
   - Tasting notes (web research + wine databases)
   - Vivino/Parker scores
   - Grape variety confirmation
   - Country/region metafields
   - **Full product descriptions (3-5 paragraphs)** — hook, tasting profile, food pairings, producer story
   - Find/verify bottle images
4. **Mika uploads to Cin7** — formatted CSV with all fields
5. **Cin7 syncs to Shopify** — products go live with rich descriptions, images, and metafields

## Description Standard:
- Minimum 3 paragraphs per product
- Para 1: Evocative hook + origin story
- Para 2: Detailed tasting profile (nose, palate, finish)
- Para 3: Specific food pairings
- Para 4: Producer/region context
- Para 5 (optional): Technical/vintage details
- Tone: Premium but approachable, like a sommelier at a wine bar

## NO product goes live with a one-sentence description. Ever.

files.name: Wine Storage Handling Sop
files.content:
# Wine Storage & Handling

## 1. Purpose & Scope

This Standard Operating Procedure establishes the requirements for storing, handling, and protecting all wine, spirits, and specialty food products within 7 Cellars' warehouse and distribution operations on Grand Cayman. It applies to all warehouse staff, delivery drivers, and management personnel.

**Why this matters:** Grand Cayman's tropical climate — with ambient temperatures regularly exceeding 30°C (86°F) and humidity above 75% — poses a direct threat to product quality. Wine begins to degrade above 25°C, and even 30 minutes of heat exposure can cause irreversible damage. 7 Cellars offers a **temperature guarantee** to every customer. This SOP is how we honour it.

---

## 2. Warehouse Temperature Standards

### 2.1 Temperature Zones

| Zone | Products | Target Temp | Acceptable Range | Humidity |
|------|----------|-------------|------------------|----------|
| **Zone A — Fine Wine** | White, rosé, sparkling | 10–12°C (50–54°F) | 8–14°C | 60–70% |
| **Zone B — Red Wine** | Red wine (all varietals) | 14–16°C (57–61°F) | 12–18°C | 60–70% |
| **Zone C — Sparkling / Champagne** | Champagne, Prosecco, Crémant | 8–10°C (46–50°F) | 6–12°C | 60–70% |
| **Zone D — Spirits** | All spirits, liqueurs | 16–20°C (61–68°F) | 14–22°C | 50–65% |
| **Zone E — Specialty Foods** | Olive oils, vinegars, specialty items | 16–20°C (61–68°F) | 14–22°C | 50–65% |

### 2.2 Critical Thresholds

- **Immediate action required** if any zone exceeds its acceptable range for more than **15 minutes**
- **Product quarantine triggered** if any zone exceeds **25°C (77°F)** for any duration
- **Warehouse evacuation protocol** (to backup cold storage) if cooling systems fail and temperatures approach **28°C (82°F)**

### 2.3 Humidity Control

- Dehumidifiers must run continuously in all zones
- Humidity above **75%** risks label damage, mould growth, and cork deterioration
- Humidity below **50%** risks cork drying and shrinkage (wine zones only)
- Inspect dehumidifier drains and filters **weekly**

---

## 3. Temperature Monitoring & Logging

### 3.1 Monitoring Equipment

- Digital temperature and humidity sensors installed in **each storage zone**
- Sensors must have **real-time remote monitoring** capability with mobile alerts
- Backup battery-powered thermometers in each zone for redundancy
- Calibrate all sensors **quarterly** — record calibration dates in the equipment log

### 3.2 Logging Requirements

| Log Type | Frequency | Responsibility |
|----------|-----------|----------------|
| Automated digital log | Continuous (every 5 min) | Monitoring system |
| Manual spot-check log | Twice daily (opening + midday) | Warehouse Lead |
| Weekly summary report | Every Monday | Warehouse Manager |
| Monthly compliance review | First week of month | Operations Manager |

### 3.3 Alert Protocol

1. **Sensor alarm triggers** → notification sent to Warehouse Lead + Manager
2. **Warehouse Lead** investigates within **10 minutes**
3. If temperature cannot be corrected within **30 minutes**, escalate to Operations Manager
4. All alarms and responses must be documented in the **Temperature Incident Log**

---

## 4. Storage Zones & Shelving Requirements

### 4.1 General Layout Principles

- Zones must be **physically separated** or use insulated partitions
- No product stored directly on the floor — minimum **10 cm (4 in)** clearance on pallets or racking
- Maintain **30 cm (12 in)** clearance from walls for air circulation
- Aisles must be a minimum of **1.2 m (4 ft)** wide for safe movement and equipment access

### 4.2 Shelving & Racking Standards

- **Wine cases:** Store on commercial-grade metal or wood racking rated for the load
- **Bottles (loose/display):** Store horizontally to keep corks moist — use purpose-built wine racking
- **Sparkling wine:** Always store horizontally; never stack cases more than **4 high**
- **Spirits:** May be stored upright; stack cases no more than **5 high**
- **Heavy cases (12-bottle):** Do not stack more than **3 high** without racking support

### 4.3 Light Exposure Prevention

- **No direct sunlight** in any storage area — windows must be blacked out or UV-filtered
- Use **LED lighting only** (no fluorescent or incandescent) — LEDs emit minimal UV
- Lights should be on **motion sensors** or switched off when zones are unoccupied
- Sparkling wine and delicate whites are most sensitive to light — prioritise their protection

---

## 5. Receiving Protocol — Container Arrivals

### 5.1 Pre-Arrival

- Confirm container arrival time with shipping agent **24 hours in advance**
- Ensure adequate cold storage space is available
- Schedule sufficient staff for unloading (minimum **2 persons** per container)
- Pre-cool the receiving bay to below **22°C** if possible

### 5.2 Container Inspection (Before Unloading)

1. **Record container number, seal number, and arrival time**
2. **Check container temperature** using an infrared thermometer at the door before opening
3. If container internal temperature exceeds **28°C (82°F):**
   - Photograph the temperature reading
   - Note on the Bill of Lading
   - Contact Operations Manager immediately
   - Proceed with unloading but **quarantine the entire shipment** for inspection
4. Open container and take **interior temperature readings** at front, middle, and rear
5. Record all readings on the **Container Receiving Form**

### 5.3 Unloading Procedure

- Unload **as quickly as possible** — target completion within **90 minutes** of opening the container
- Transfer product directly into the appropriate temperature zone — **do not stage product in the sun or in uncooled areas**
- Two-person teams: one inside the container, one transferring to storage
- Check each pallet/stack for visible damage (crushed cases, leaking, wet cardboard)
- Damaged items are separated immediately and logged on the **Damage Report Form**

### 5.4 Documentation

For every container received, complete and file:

- Container Receiving Form (temp readings, condition, time log)
- Bill of Lading (signed, with any annotations)
- Damage Report Form (if applicable)
- Photograph any irregularities

---

## 6. FIFO Stock Rotation

### 6.1 First In, First Out (FIFO)

- All product must be rotated on a **strict FIFO basis**
- New stock is placed **behind or below** existing stock of the same product
- Date of receipt must be clearly marked on every pallet, case, or shelf position
- Use **colour-coded date labels** by month for quick visual verification:

| Month Received | Label Colour |
|----------------|-------------|
| Jan–Mar | Blue |
| Apr–Jun | Green |
| Jul–Sep | Yellow |
| Oct–Dec | Red |

### 6.2 Inventory Checks

- **Weekly:** Warehouse Lead walks each zone to verify FIFO compliance
- **Monthly:** Full physical inventory count
- **Quarterly:** Reconcile physical count against inventory management system (Cin7)
- Any discrepancies of more than **2%** by value require investigation and written report

---

## 7. Case & Bottle Handling Standards

### 7.1 General Handling Rules

- **Never throw, drop, or slide cases** — wine bottles are fragile and can micro-fracture without visible damage
- Carry cases from the bottom — not by the flaps or cardboard lid
- Use **two hands** for individual bottles; grip the body, not the neck
- Sparkling wine requires extra care — pressurised bottles are more fragile and dangerous if broken

### 7.2 Equipment Handling

- **Forklifts:** Only certified operators may operate forklifts in the warehouse
- Forklift speed limit inside the warehouse: **5 km/h (3 mph)**
- Forklifts must not be used in wine storage zones unless absolutely necessary — prefer hand trucks and pallet jacks
- **Pallet jacks:** Preferred for moving pallets within zones
- **Hand trucks / dollies:** Use for case-level moves and deliveries

### 7.3 Delivery Vehicle Loading

- Delivery vehicles must be **pre-cooled to below 20°C** before loading product
- Load wine last (closest to the vehicle's cooling unit)
- Secure all cases to prevent shifting during transport
- Maximum time from warehouse to customer delivery: **2 hours** in cooled vehicle
- If vehicle cooling fails, return product to warehouse immediately

---

## 8. Damaged & Defective Product Protocol

### 8.1 Types of Damage

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| **Transit damage** | Crushed cases, broken bottles, heat damage from shipping |
| **Storage damage** | Temperature excursion, humidity/mould, light exposure |
| **Handling damage** | Drops, forklift incidents, improper stacking |
| **Product defect** | Cork taint, oxidation, off-flavours, sediment (manufacturing fault) |

### 8.2 Internal Discovery

1. Remove damaged product from saleable inventory immediately
2. Photograph the damage (minimum 3 photos: overview, detail, label)
3. Complete the **Damage Report Form** with date, product details, quantity, and suspected cause
4. Store damaged product in the **designated quarantine area** (clearly labelled, separate from saleable stock)
5. Notify the Operations Manager within **4 hours**
6. Operations Manager determines disposition: return to supplier, write off, or salvage

### 8.3 Customer Claims — 48-Hour Window

7 Cellars maintains a **48-hour claim window** for customers:

- Customers must report damaged or defective product within **48 hours of delivery**
- Customer must provide **photographic evidence** of the issue
- Claims are logged in the **Customer Claims Register** with: date, customer name, product, invoice number, description, photos
- **Resolution timeline:** Acknowledge claim within **4 business hours**; resolve (replacement or credit) within **48 business hours**
- All claims are reviewed monthly to identify patterns and prevent recurrence

### 8.4 Supplier Claims

- Transit damage claims must be filed with the shipping company within **5 business days** of container arrival
- Product defect claims are filed with the supplier/producer within **10 business days** of discovery
- Maintain photographic evidence and retain defective product until claim is resolved

---

## 9. Opening Hours & Access Control

### 9.1 Standard Operating Hours

| Day | Hours |
|-----|-------|
| Monday – Friday | 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM |
| Saturday | 8:00 AM – 12:00 PM (receiving only) |
| Sunday & Public Holidays | Closed |

### 9.2 Access Control

- Warehouse access restricted to **authorised personnel only**
- All visitors must sign in at reception and be escorted at all times
- Key/code holders: Warehouse Manager, Operations Manager, Director of Sales
- After-hours access requires **prior written approval** from the Operations Manager
- Security cameras must cover all entry points and storage zones — footage retained for **30 days minimum**

### 9.3 Delivery Access

- Delivery drivers may enter the loading bay area only
- Drivers do not enter storage zones without warehouse staff escort
- Customer pickups occur at the designated pickup window or loading bay

---

## 10. Emergency Procedures

### 10.1 Power Outage

| Time Without Power | Action |
|--------------------|--------|
| 0–30 minutes | Monitor temperatures; keep all doors closed |
| 30–60 minutes | Start backup generator (if available); alert Operations Manager |
| 1–2 hours | Begin transferring high-value and sensitive stock (sparkling, white) to backup cold storage |
| 2+ hours | Full inventory transfer to backup cold storage; activate emergency supplier contacts for refrigerated truck rental |

- **Backup generator** must be tested monthly and have minimum **8 hours of fuel**
- Maintain a current list of **emergency refrigerated storage contacts** (posted in the warehouse office)
- CUC (Cayman Utilities) outage hotline: keep number posted at all workstations

### 10.2 Hurricane Preparedness

**Hurricane Season: June 1 – November 30**

**When a Hurricane Watch is issued (48 hours):**
- Verify backup generator fuel levels
- Secure loose items in and around the warehouse
- Ensure all product is on racking (nothing on the floor)
- Back up all inventory and temperature records to the cloud
- Confirm emergency contact list is current

**When a Hurricane Warning is issued (36 hours):**
- Move high-value inventory to the most protected interior zone
- Secure warehouse doors, shutters, and loading bays
- Fill backup water containers (for generator cooling if needed)
- Ensure insurance documentation is accessible
- Warehouse Manager makes final walkthrough before lockdown

**Post-Storm:**
- Do not enter the warehouse until cleared as safe
- Document any damage with photos and video before moving anything
- Check all temperature logs — determine if cold chain was maintained
- File insurance claims within **72 hours**

### 10.3 Fire

- Fire extinguishers (Class A and Class B) at every zone entry point — inspected **annually**
- Evacuation route posted at all exits
- In case of fire: evacuate immediately, call **911**, do not attempt to save product
- Warehouse Manager contacts insurance provider within **24 hours**

### 10.4 Flooding / Water Intrusion

- If water enters the warehouse, immediately move product off lowest racking levels
- Check drainage and sump pumps
- Photograph all water damage before cleanup
- File damage report and insurance claim as needed

---

## 11. Staff Training & Compliance

### 11.1 Required Training

All warehouse staff must complete the following before working independently:

- **Orientation:** Warehouse layout, zones, and temperature standards
- **Handling training:** Proper case and bottle handling techniques
- **Equipment certification:** Forklift/pallet jack operation (where applicable)
- **Emergency procedures:** Fire, hurricane, power outage
- **FIFO and inventory:** Stock rotation and labelling

### 11.2 Refresher Training

- **Quarterly:** Temperature monitoring and emergency procedures review
- **Annually:** Full SOP review and sign-off
- **As needed:** After any incident or significant SOP update

### 11.3 Compliance

- Violations of this SOP are taken seriously — product quality is our reputation
- First violation: verbal warning and retraining
- Second violation: written warning
- Third violation: disciplinary action up to and including termination

---

## 12. Document Control

| Detail | Information |
|--------|-------------|
| **Document Owner** | Operations Manager |
| **Approved By** | Director of Sales |
| **Effective Date** | February 2026 |
| **Review Frequency** | Annually (or after significant incident) |
| **Version** | 1.0 |

---

*This SOP is the property of 7 Cellars Ltd. and is intended for internal use only. Unauthorised distribution is prohibited.*

files.name: Yacht Villa Provisioning Sop
files.content:
# Yacht & Villa Provisioning — Standard Operating Procedure

## 1. Purpose & Scope

This SOP defines the end-to-end process for 7 Cellars' **Yacht & Villa Provisioning** channel — from initial inquiry through delivery, restocking, and relationship management. It covers superyacht provisioning (vessels in port or anchored off Seven Mile Beach), luxury villa rentals, and private residence requests across Grand Cayman.

**Revenue Target:** CI$50,000–100,000+ annually from this channel alone.

**Clientele:** Ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) individuals, superyacht chefs, charter captains, villa property managers, concierge services, and charter brokers.

---

## 2. Channel Development

### 2.1 Target Partners

| Partner Type | Examples | Value Proposition |
|---|---|---|
| Yacht Management Companies | Camper & Nicholsons, Burgess, Y.CO | Preferred provisioning partner for all Cayman port calls |
| Charter Brokers | Fraser, Northrop & Johnson, IYC | Pre-arrival provisioning packages for charter guests |
| Villa Property Managers | CIREBA luxury rentals, Cayman Villas, Island Pine Villas | Welcome packages and ongoing supply for guest stays |
| Concierge Services | Hotel concierge desks, private concierge firms | Commission-based referral for guest provisioning |
| Yacht Agents | Local clearing agents handling port logistics | First point of contact when vessels arrive |
| Private Chefs | Independent chefs serving villas and yachts | Trusted advisor relationship — they influence purchasing |

### 2.2 Partnership Development Process

1. **Identify** — Build and maintain a target list of yacht management firms, charter brokers, villa managers, and concierge providers active in Grand Cayman
2. **Outreach** — Personal introduction with provisioning catalog, sample hamper, and partnership overview
3. **Onboard** — Establish ordering preferences, billing terms, delivery contacts, and communication channels (WhatsApp preferred for speed)
4. **Incentivize** — Offer commission structure (5–10% referral fee) or volume-based pricing for consistent partners
5. **Nurture** — Quarterly check-ins, seasonal catalog updates, exclusive first-access to new products

### 2.3 Seasonal Opportunities

| Season | Opportunity | Action |
|---|---|---|
| **Nov–Apr** (High Season) | Peak yacht traffic, villa occupancy at maximum | Full provisioning push — proactive outreach to brokers 30 days before known arrivals |
| **Easter / Spring Break** | Family charters, villa bookings surge | Family-friendly packages, rosé & sparkling bundles |
| **Pirates Week (Nov)** | Local celebration, visiting vessels | Themed provisioning packages |
| **Cayman Cookout (Jan)** | Celebrity chef event, foodie clientele | Premium pairing menus, rare wine allocations |
| **Summer** | Reduced yacht traffic, some villa stays | Maintenance of relationships, catalog refresh, off-season pricing for loyal accounts |

---

## 3. Provisioning Catalog

### 3.1 Catalog Structure

The provisioning catalog is a curated, branded PDF and digital document (not the full retail inventory). It is organized into:

- **Champagne & Sparkling** — Prestige cuvées, grower Champagne, Crémant
- **White Wine** — By region (Burgundy, Loire, New Zealand, California, Italy)
- **Rosé** — Provence, Spanish, Italian
- **Red Wine** — By region (Bordeaux, Burgundy, Napa, Barossa, Tuscany)
- **Spirits** — Premium and ultra-premium (whisky, rum, tequila, gin, vodka, cognac)
- **Specialty Foods** — Cheese, charcuterie, caviar, olive oil, artisan crackers, honeycomb
- **Curated Packages** — Pre-built bundles (see Section 3.2)

### 3.2 Curated Provisioning Packages

| Package | Contents | Price Range (CI$) |
|---|---|---|
| **Welcome Aboard** | 1 Champagne, 2 whites, 2 reds, cheese board, charcuterie platter | $400–600 |
| **Sunset Session** | 2 rosé, 1 sparkling, olives, hummus, flatbreads | $200–350 |
| **Captain's Reserve** | 6 premium reds, 2 whites, 1 Champagne, full cheese & charcuterie spread | $800–1,200 |
| **Chef's Pantry** | Olive oils, vinegars, specialty salts, truffle products, cooking wines | $300–500 |
| **Celebration Package** | 3 prestige Champagnes, caviar, smoked salmon, blinis | $1,000–1,800 |
| **Full Charter Provision** | Custom — complete wine, spirits, and food for charter duration | $2,500–10,000+ |
| **Villa Welcome** | 1 Champagne, 1 white, 1 red, fruit & cheese platter, welcome card | $250–400 |

### 3.3 Catalog Maintenance

- **Update quarterly** with new arrivals, seasonal selections, and price adjustments
- **Version control** — each catalog dated and versioned (e.g., "Spring 2026 v1")
- **Digital delivery** via WhatsApp, email, or printed copies for key partners
- **Include QR code** linking to WhatsApp ordering for instant inquiries

---

## 4. Inquiry Handling

### 4.1 Inquiry Channels

| Channel | Response Target |
|---|---|
| WhatsApp (primary) | Within 15 minutes during business hours |
| Phone | Immediate answer or callback within 30 minutes |
| Email | Within 2 hours during business hours |
| Partner referral | Within 30 minutes of notification |

### 4.2 Inquiry Workflow

1. **Receive inquiry** — Log in CRM with source (partner, direct, referral), client name, vessel/villa name, dates
2. **Qualify** — Determine scope: one-time order, charter provisioning, ongoing villa supply
3. **Consult** — If the client has a chef or property manager, connect directly to understand preferences, dietary restrictions, allergies, and budget
4. **Recommend** — Send tailored selection from provisioning catalog with wine notes and pairing suggestions
5. **Confirm** — Finalize order, confirm delivery date/time, arrange payment
6. **Handoff** — Pass confirmed order to fulfillment (Section 5)

### 4.3 Key Information to Capture

- Client / vessel / villa name
- Number of guests and duration of stay
- Dietary restrictions or preferences
- Budget range (if offered)
- Delivery address and access instructions (marina berth, dock code, villa gate code)
- Preferred contact (chef, captain, property manager, guest directly)
- Billing contact and method (credit card, wire transfer, account terms)

---

## 5. Order Processing

### 5.1 Order Confirmation

- Every order receives a **written confirmation** (WhatsApp message or email) including:
  - Itemized list with quantities and prices
  - Delivery date and time window
  - Total including delivery fee (if applicable)
  - Payment terms

### 5.2 Pricing Structure

| Category | Pricing Model |
|---|---|
| Standard provisioning | Retail + 20% provisioning premium |
| Premium / rare wines | Retail + 25–30% provisioning premium |
| Curated packages | Fixed package pricing (built-in margin) |
| Specialty foods | Retail + 20% provisioning premium |
| Same-day rush (after 12:00 PM cutoff) | Additional 15% rush surcharge |
| After-hours delivery (after 6:00 PM) | CI$75 surcharge |
| Restocking (mid-charter) | No additional surcharge beyond standard provisioning premium |

### 5.3 Payment Terms

- **New clients:** Payment in full before delivery (credit card or wire)
- **Established accounts:** Net 15 terms with approved credit application
- **Charter brokers / management companies:** Net 30 with signed provisioning agreement
- **Deposits:** 50% deposit required for orders over CI$2,500

### 5.4 Cutoff Times

| Order Type | Cutoff | Delivery |
|---|---|---|
| Same-day delivery | 12:00 PM | By 5:00 PM same day |
| Next-day delivery | 5:00 PM | By 12:00 PM next day |
| Pre-arrival provisioning | 48 hours before arrival | Delivered to vessel/villa before guest arrival |
| Rush / emergency | No cutoff | Subject to availability + rush surcharge |

---

## 6. Packaging & Presentation

### 6.1 Branded Packaging Standards

All provisioning deliveries use **7 Cellars branded materials:**

- **Wine:** Delivered in branded insulated wine totes or wooden crates (6-bottle or 12-bottle)
- **Spirits:** Individual bottles in branded gift bags or displayed in branded hampers
- **Specialty Foods:** Arranged in branded cooler hampers with ice packs for temperature-sensitive items
- **Full provisions:** Custom branded coolers (hard-sided, reusable) with 7 Cellars logo — coolers left on loan, collected at charter end or next delivery

### 6.2 Presentation Materials Included

Every delivery includes:

- **Pairing menu** — Printed card with wine-by-wine tasting notes and food pairing suggestions, tailored to the order
- **Chef's guide** — If specialty foods are included, a guide with serving suggestions, ideal temperatures, and shelf life
- **7 Cellars provisioning card** — Contact details, reorder QR code, WhatsApp link
- **Welcome note** — Personalized note from Roberto (handwritten for orders over CI$1,000)

### 6.3 Temperature Control

- All wine delivered at appropriate serving temperature where possible
- Whites and rosés in chilled coolers (8–12°C)
- Reds at cellar temperature (14–18°C)
- Cheese and charcuterie in insulated hampers with ice packs
- Caviar in dedicated cold chain packaging

---

## 7. Delivery & Setup

### 7.1 Delivery Process

1. **Preparation** — Assemble order, verify against confirmation, package per Section 6 standards
2. **Quality check** — Second person verifies order completeness and packaging quality before departure
3. **Transport** — Branded delivery vehicle, climate-controlled where possible
4. **Arrival** — Contact delivery point (chef, captain, property manager) 30 minutes before arrival
5. **Setup** — Deliver to vessel/villa, organize in wine storage or refrigeration as directed by chef/manager
6. **Walk-through** — Brief the chef or manager on the delivery: highlight key wines, note any items requiring immediate refrigeration, present pairing menu
7. **Sign-off** — Obtain delivery confirmation signature (digital or physical)
8. **Follow-up** — WhatsApp message to ordering contact confirming successful delivery

### 7.2 Yacht-Specific Considerations

- **Marina access** — Maintain current dock access credentials for Cayman Islands Yacht Club, Barcadere Marina, and Safe Haven
- **Tender delivery** — For vessels at anchor, coordinate tender pickup or arrange water taxi delivery
- **Gangway protocol** — Follow vessel-specific boarding procedures; always contact crew before boarding
- **Storage** — Work with chef to organize wine locker, beverage fridges, and pantry storage

### 7.3 Villa-Specific Considerations

- **Gate/key access** — Coordinate with property manager for entry codes or key handoff
- **Pre-arrival setup** — For welcome packages, arrive 2+ hours before guest check-in
- **Display** — Arrange wines on counter or in wine fridge; set up cheese/charcuterie display if within 2 hours of arrival
- **Restocking** — Coordinate recurring delivery schedule with property manager for longer stays

---

## 8. Mid-Charter & Mid-Stay Restocking

### 8.1 Proactive Restocking

- **Day 2–3 check-in** — WhatsApp message to chef or property manager: "How is everything? Ready for a top-up?"
- **Anticipate needs** — Based on original order size and guest count, suggest restocking quantities
- **Standing orders** — For longer charters (7+ days) or extended villa stays, establish a recurring delivery schedule (e.g., every 3 days)
- **Emergency requests** — Available for same-day restocking with standard cutoff times; rush delivery available after hours

### 8.2 Restocking Workflow

1. Receive restock request (WhatsApp, phone, or pre-arranged schedule)
2. Confirm items and delivery time
3. Process as standard order (no additional surcharge for restocking)
4. Deliver and set up per Section 7 standards
5. Collect any empty coolers or crates from previous delivery

---

## 9. Post-Charter & Post-Stay Follow-Up

### 9.1 Follow-Up Timeline

| Timing | Action |
|---|---|
| Day of departure | Collect branded coolers/crates from vessel or villa |
| 1–2 days after departure | Thank-you message to chef, captain, or property manager |
| 1 week after departure | Email to booking agent or management company with order summary and feedback request |
| Pre-next visit | If return visit is scheduled, proactive outreach with updated catalog and preferences on file |

### 9.2 Follow-Up Content

- **Thank-you note** — Personal message from Roberto acknowledging the order and relationship
- **Feedback request** — Brief: "Was everything to your satisfaction? Anything we should adjust for next time?"
- **Preference file update** — Record any feedback, preferences, or notes in CRM for future orders
- **Referral ask** — For satisfied clients: "We'd love to serve your colleagues — feel free to share our details"

### 9.3 Loyalty Program

- **Returning vessels/villas:** 5% loyalty discount on third and subsequent provisions
- **Annual accounts:** Volume-based pricing negotiated at year-end review
- **VIP tier:** Clients spending CI$10,000+ annually receive complimentary welcome Champagne on each visit and priority same-day service

---

## 10. Relationship Building & CRM

### 10.1 CRM Requirements

Every yacht, villa, and client contact maintained in CRM with:

- Contact details (WhatsApp, email, phone)
- Role (chef, captain, property manager, broker, guest)
- Vessel or villa name and details
- Order history with itemized records
- Preferences and dietary notes
- Visit dates and frequency
- Notes on personal preferences (e.g., "Captain prefers Barossa Shiraz," "Chef requests organic-only olive oil")

### 10.2 Relationship Touchpoints

| Frequency | Action |
|---|---|
| Each visit | Personalized service, handwritten note for large orders |
| Monthly | Newsletter to partner network (new products, seasonal picks) |
| Quarterly | Catalog update sent to all active partners |
| Annually | Year-in-review for top accounts with volume summary and loyalty pricing |
| Ad hoc | Invitations to 7 Cellars tastings, wine dinners, or Cayman food events |

### 10.3 Partner Communication

- **Primary channel:** WhatsApp for speed and informality
- **Catalog and formal proposals:** Email with branded PDF attachments
- **In-person:** Quarterly visits to key partners (yacht clubs, management offices, villa agencies)

---

## 11. Roles & Responsibilities

| Role | Responsibilities |
|---|---|
| **Director of Sales (Roberto)** | Partner development, key account management, pricing approval, catalog curation, tasting notes |
| **Operations / Fulfillment** | Order assembly, packaging, quality checks, inventory coordination |
| **Delivery Team** | Transport, vessel/villa setup, cooler collection, client-facing presentation |
| **Administration** | Invoicing, payment collection, CRM maintenance, partner onboarding paperwork |

---

## 12. Key Performance Indicators

| KPI | Target |
|---|---|
| Channel revenue | CI$50,000+ Year 1, CI$100,000+ Year 2 |
| Average order value | CI$500+ |
| Same-day delivery success rate | 95%+ |
| Repeat client rate | 60%+ |
| Partner referral volume | 5+ active referring partners |
| Customer satisfaction (feedback) | 4.8/5.0+ |
| Response time (inquiry to quote) | Under 30 minutes |

---

## 13. Appendices

### Appendix A — Sample Welcome Message (WhatsApp)

> Good morning! Welcome to Grand Cayman. I'm Roberto from 7 Cellars — your dedicated wine, spirits, and specialty food provisioning partner on-island.
>
> I'd love to send over our curated provisioning catalog. Whether you're looking for a welcome Champagne, a full charter wine list, or artisan cheese and charcuterie, we deliver directly to your vessel or villa with full setup.
>
> Same-day delivery available for orders placed by noon. Just let me know how I can help!

### Appendix B — Delivery Checklist

- [ ] Order verified against confirmation (items, quantities, vintages)
- [ ] Packaging meets 7 Cellars branded standards
- [ ] Temperature-appropriate storage used for transport
- [ ] Pairing menu printed and included
- [ ] Chef's guide included (if specialty foods in order)
- [ ] 7 Cellars provisioning card included
- [ ] Personalized welcome note included (orders over CI$1,000)
- [ ] Delivery contact notified 30 minutes prior
- [ ] Products organized in vessel/villa storage
- [ ] Walk-through completed with chef or manager
- [ ] Delivery confirmation obtained
- [ ] Follow-up message sent

### Appendix C — Pricing Quick Reference

| Item | Standard Retail | Provisioning Price |
|---|---|---|
| Wine (standard) | Retail price | Retail + 20% |
| Wine (premium / allocated) | Retail price | Retail + 25–30% |
| Spirits | Retail price | Retail + 20% |
| Specialty foods | Retail price | Retail + 20% |
| Same-day rush surcharge | — | +15% on order total |
| After-hours delivery | — | CI$75 flat fee |
| Curated packages | — | Fixed price (see catalog) |

---

*This SOP is a living document. Review and update quarterly or as the provisioning channel evolves.*

*Last updated: February 2026*
*Prepared for: 7 Cellars — Grand Cayman*
